454.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-57-104, 37-57-105 And 37-57-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Authority Of School Boards To Increase Ad Valorem Taxes Levied For School District Purposes By More Than Two Percent Over The Amount Levied In The Preceding Year Absent Approval By A Majority Vote In A Referendum On The Proposed Tax Increase; To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

455.title: Network pharmacy; may decline to provide certain drugs if networks pays less than acquisition cost.
455.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Network Pharmacy Or Pharmacist That Has A Contract With A Pharmacy Benefits Manager To Provide Covered Drugs At A Negotiated Reimbursement Rate May Decline To Provide Certain Drugs Or Services If The Network Pays Less Than The Pharmacy's Or Pharmacist's Acquisition Cost For The Product; To Amend Sections 73-21-157 And 73-21-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Part Of The Pharmacy Benefit Prompt Pay Act, To Delete The Repealers On Those Sections; And For Related Purposes.

456.title: School districts; require SDE to fully fund those whose local contribution has reached millage rate cap under MAEP.
456.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Department Of Education To Fully Fund School Districts That Have Reached The Maximum Limit On Their Millage Rate Cap Of Twenty-eight Mills Assessed For The Local Contribution Of Revenue Generated In Support Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

457.title: MAEP; bring forward related sections for purpose of possible revisions.

458.title: MAEP; reduce amount of increase to recalculate base student cost from 40% to 20%.
458.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Amount Of The Increase To The Base Student Cost For Each Fiscal Year Between Recalculation Of The Base Student Cost From Forty Percent To Twenty Percent Of The Immediate Previous Fiscal Year's Calculated Amount; And For Related Purposes.

459.title: Department of Revenue; revise date upon which time period begins to run for taxpayer to request hearing on permit revocation/suspension.
459.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-77-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Date Upon Which The Time Period Begins To Run To File A Written Request With The Board Of Review Of The Department Of Revenue For A Hearing On The Suspension, Surrender, Seizure Or Revocation Of A Permit, Tag Or Title Issued Or Approved By The Department Of Revenue; And For Related Purposes.

460.title: Income tax; provide that filing date for state return is the same as filing date for corresponding federal return.
460.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Date For Filing Income Tax Returns Of Individuals, Estates, Trusts, Partnerships And Corporations; To Provide That The Date For Filing Such Returns Shall Be The Same As That Provided For Filing A Corresponding Federal Return; And For Related Purposes.

461.title: Pharmacy Practice Act; extend repealer on.
461.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Mississippi Pharmacy Practice Act And Include Additional Sections In The Repealer; To Reenact Sections 73-21-71 Through 73-21-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Mississippi Pharmacy Practice Act; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-21-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Some Minor Nonsubstantive Changes; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-21-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When An Election Is Required By The Mississippi Pharmacists Association To Narrow The Number Of Potential Candidates For Nominations To The Board, The Association Shall Provide A Ballot To Each Licensed Pharmacist; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-21-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides That The State Board Of Pharmacy Shall Regulate The Practice Of Pharmacy And Pharmacy Benefit Managers, To Delete The Individual Repealer On That Section; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-21-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For License Renewal Fees For Pharmacists And Pharmacy Benefit Managers, To Delete The Individual Repealer On That Section; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-21-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Board May Impose A Monetary Penalty For Any Person Who Uses The Prescription Monitoring Program In Any Manner Other Than That For Which It Was Intended; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board To Determine The Registration Period For Facilities That Engage In The Wholesale Distribution Of Prescription Drugs And Reverse Distributors And To Prescribe Fees For Registration Of Wholesalers; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-21-106, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Board Shall Establish The Criteria That Each Nonresident Pharmacy Must Meet To Qualify For A Nonresident Permit; To Provide That After A Permit Has Been Issued, It May Not Be Amended, Transferred Or Reassigned; To Provide That A Pharmacist-in-charge Of A Nonresident Pharmacy May Not Be The Pharmacist-in-charge At Any Other Location That Has Been Issued A Permit By The Board; To Bring Forward Section 73-21-125, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Civil Immunity For Community Pharmacies And Pharmacists Working In Those Pharmacies, To Include The Section In The General Repealer On The Pharmacy Practice Act; To Amend Section 73-21-126, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Regulation Of Wholesale Distributors, Chain Pharmacy Warehouses And Repackagers, To Include The Section In The General Repealer On The Pharmacy Practice Act And Make Some Minor Nonsubstantive Changes; To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes A Controlled Substances Prescription Monitoring Program (pmp), To Include That Section In The General Repealer On The Pharmacy Practice Act And Delete The Individual Repealer On The Section; To Provide That Pharmacists Licensed By The Mississippi Board Of Pharmacy Must Be Registered Users Of The Pmp; To Provide That The Pmp Through The Board May Establish The Cost Of Administration, Maintenance, And Operation Of The Program And Charge Agencies A Fee Based On A Formula To Be Determined By The Board, Assess Charges For Information And/or Statistical Data Provided To Agencies, Institutions And Individuals; To Provide That Any Misuse Of The Pmp Is Subject To Penalties; To Provide That The Board And The Pmp Shall Be Immune From Civil Liability Arising From Inaccuracy Of Any Of The Information Submitted To The Program; To Amend Section 73-21-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Drug Manufacturers To Allow Pharmacies To Return Outdated Drugs For Credit Or Refund, To Include That Section In The General Repealer On The Pharmacy Practice Act And Delete The Individual Repealer On The Section; And For Related Purposes.

462.title: Town of Walnut; authorize expansion of natural gas system.
462.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Walnut In Tippah County, Mississippi, To Expand Its Gas Distribution System Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The Town Of Walnut; And For Related Purposes.

463.title: MAEP; define "at-risk pupil" and include a child diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder.
463.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "at-risk Pupil" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program And To Include A Child Diagnosed With An Autism Spectrum Disorder In The Definition; And For Related Purposes.

464.title: Adequate Education Program; increase adjustment to base student cost for at-risk students.
464.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Adjustment To The Base Student Cost For At-risk Students Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

465.title: MAEP; revise definition of "at-risk pupils" for purpose of determining the 5% adjustment to base student cost.
465.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of "at-risk Pupils" Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program For Purposes Of Determining The Five Percent Adjustment To The Base Student Cost By Categorizing Pupils Based On Level Of Proficiency On State Standardized Assessments For Grade Levels That Require Such Assessments, Or Based On The Number Of Students Participating In The Federal Free School Lunch Program For Grade Levels For Which No State Standardized Assessment Is Required Or Has Been Developed; And For Related Purposes.

466.title: MAEP; determine cost of using average daily membership (ADM) in lieu of ADA with 95% threshold attendance trigger.
466.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "average Daily Membership (adm)" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Determination Of The Basic Adequate Education Program Cost For Each School District Based On Student Average Daily Membership With Certain Exceptions; To Provide For Student Counts By The State Auditor; To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "minimum School Term" And "average Daily Attendance" As Such Terms Are Used For Determining Allocations To School Districts Under The Adequate Education Program; To Amend Sections 37-151-85, 37-151-97 And 37-151-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Section 37-13-91, To Remove The Attendance Requirement That A Compulsory-school-age Child Who Is Absent More Than 37% Of The Instructional Day Must Be Considered Absent For The Entire Day; And For Related Purposes.

467.title: MAEP funds; require school districts to identify categories of funds by maintaining separate accounts for each.
467.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Board Of Education Shall Require School Districts Receiving Allocations Of Maep Funds To Identify The Categories Of Funds Received By Maintaining A Separate Fund For Each Category Of Funding; To Require The State Department Of Education To Provide The Methods By Which School Districts Shall Account For Expenditure Of All Funds From Each Category Of Maep Funds And For Reporting Such Expenditures And Fund Balances To The Department; To Authorize The Board To Determine How Districts Are Held Accountable For The Expenditure Of Categorical Funds; And For Related Purposes.

468.title: MAEP; remove requirement that the Legislature shall fully fund annually.
468.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Adequate Education Program Shall Only Be Funded At A Level In The Discretion Of The Legislature As Funds Are Available; And For Related Purposes.

469.title: MS Debt Management Services Act; extend repealer on.
469.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 81-22-1 Through 81-22-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Mississippi Debt Management Services Act; To Amend Section 81-22-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Mississippi Debt Management Services Act; And For Related Purposes.

470.title: MS S.A.F.E. Mortgage Act; extend repealer on.
470.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 81-18-1 Through 81-18-49 And Sections 81-18-53 Through 81-18-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act; To Amend Section 81-18-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act; To Amend Reenacted Sections 81-18-9, 81-18-15 And 81-18-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Several Minor Nonsubstantive Changes; And For Related Purposes.

471.title: Mississippi Appraisal Management Company Registration Act; extend repealer on registration requirement for appraisal management companies.
471.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-34-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits An Appraisal Management Company From Engaging In Or Conducting Business In This State Without First Obtaining A Registration Issued By The Mississippi Real Estate Appraiser Licensing And Certification Board Under The Mississippi Appraisal Management Company Registration Act, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Such Section; And For Related Purposes.

472.title: Physician Assistants; extend repealer on authority for issuance of temporary license to applicants in master's degree program.
472.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-26-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision That Authorizes The Issuance Of A Temporary License To Applicants For Licensure As A Physician Assistant Who Meet All Licensure Requirements Except For The Master's Degree Upon Proof Of Enrollment In A Master's Program That Will Meet The Master's Degree Requirement; And For Related Purposes.

474.title: MS Boll Weevil Management Corporation; extend repealer on provision requiring annual audits to be provided by November 15.
474.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-37-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Provision Of Law That Requires The Boll Weevil Management Corporation To Provide An Annual Audit Of Its Accounts By November 15; And For Related Purposes.

475.title: Income tax; extend repealer on tax credit for certain employers sponsoring skills training for employees.
475.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides An Income Tax Credit For Certain Employers Sponsoring Skills Training For Employees, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Section; And For Related Purposes.

476.title: Forest acreage tax; extend repealer on law requiring certain counties to levy.
476.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-19-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Provision Of Law That Requires Certain Counties To Levy A Forest Acreage Tax; And For Related Purposes.

477.title: Task Force on the Future of Gifted Education in MS; extend repealer on.
477.description: An Act To Amend Section 1, Chapter 430, Laws Of 2015, To Extend By Three Years The Repealer Of The Provision Of Law Creating The Task Force On The Future Of Gifted Education In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

478.title: State offenders serving sentences in county jails; extend repealer on.
478.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 47-5-901 Through 47-5-909, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Conditions Under Which State Offenders May Serve Sentences In County Jails; To Amend Section 47-5-911, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Those Reenacted Code Sections From July 1, 2016, To July 1, 2020; And For Related Purposes.

479.title: CON; extend repealer on authority of Health Department to approve change of ownership of part of health care facility.
479.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision That Authorizes The State Department Of Health To Approve A Change Of Ownership Of A Part Of A Health Care Facility; And For Related Purposes.

480.title: Mississippi Small Business Regulatory Flexibility Act; extend repealer on.
480.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 25-43-4.101 Through 25-43-4.108, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Small Business Regulatory Flexibility Act; To Amend Section 25-43-4.109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provisions Of Law That Create The Mississippi Small Business Regulatory Flexibility Act; And For Related Purposes.

481.title: Medicaid; extend repealers on dental services and the dialysis transportation program.
481.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision That Provides Medicaid Coverage For Dental Services; To Amend Section 43-13-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Temporary Program To Provide Nonemergency Transportation For Certain Low-income Aged Or Disabled Persons To Receive Dialysis Services; And For Related Purposes.

482.title: Burn care lien for qualifying providers; extend repealer on statutes establishing.
482.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 85-7-301 Through 85-7-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create A Burn Care Lien For Qualifying Providers; To Amend Section 85-7-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On Those Sections; And For Related Purposes.

483.title: Small Business and Grocer Investment Act; extend repealer on.
483.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 57-10-701 Through 57-10-709, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Small Business And Grocer Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-10-711, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Sections Of Law That Create The Small Business And Grocer Investment Act; And For Related Purposes.

484.title: MS Veterans Monument Commission; extend repealer on.
484.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 55-15-51 Through 55-15-62, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission And Established Its Powers And Duties; To Amend Reenacted Section 55-15-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend By The Three Years The Repealer On The Sections Of Law Providing For The Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission; And For Related Purposes.

485.title: Mississippi Gulf Coast Region Utility Board; extend repealer on.
485.description: An Act To Amend Sections 49-17-707, 49-17-709, 49-17-711 And 49-17-713, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Provisions Of Law That Create The Mississippi Gulf Coast Region Utility Board; And For Related Purposes.

486.title: Wild hogs; extend repealer on provisions relating to the importation, release and transportation of.
486.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-140, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Violation Of A Regulation Of The Mississippi Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks Relating To Wild Hogs Is A Class I Violation; To Delete The Repealer On The Provision Of Law Relating To The Transportation And Release Of Wild Hogs; And For Related Purposes.

487.title: Health Care Trust Fund; extend repealer on.
487.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-405, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Health Care Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

488.title: Patient's Right to Informed Health Care Choices Act and prohibitions against deceptive advertising by health care providers; delete repealers on.
488.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 41-121-1, 41-121-3, 41-121-5, 41-121-7 And 41-121-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is "the Patient's Right To Informed Health Care Choices Act" Relating To Advertisements For Health Care Services; To Amend Section 41-121-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On "the Patient's Right To Informed Health Care Choices Act"; To Amend Sections 73-6-19, 73-9-61, 73-15-29, 73-19-23, 73-21-97, 73-25-29, 73-26-5, 73-27-13 And 73-39-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealers On The Provisions That Make Violations Of The Patient's Right To Informed Health Care Choices Act By Health Care Practitioners As Specific Grounds For Disciplinary Action Against Licensees; And For Related Purposes.

489.title: Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship for Students with Dyslexia Program; extend repealer on.
489.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 37-173-1, 37-173-3, 37-173-5, 37-173-7, 37-173-9, 37-173-11, 37-173-13, 37-173-15, 37-173-17, 37-173-19, 37-173-21, 37-173-23, 37-173-25 And 37-173-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Provisions Of Law Which Establish The Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship For Students With Dyslexia Program; To Amend Reenacted Section 37-173-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend For Three Years The Repealer On The Provision Of Law That Repeals The Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship For Students With Dyslexia Program; And For Related Purposes.

490.title: Emergency telecommunicators; extend repealers on training requirements and funding.
490.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Minimum Standards For Emergency Telecommunicators; To Amend Section 19-5-357, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Funding For The Training Of Such Telecommunicators; And For Related Purposes.

491.title: Public lands; delete repealer on provision of law restricting the purchase of by certain persons and business entities.
491.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-1-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Restrictions Imposed Upon The Purchase Of Public Lands By Certain Persons And Business Entities; And For Related Purposes.

492.title: Robert G. Clark, Jr., Building; extend repealer on duty of DFA to enter into private lease with an entity to provide healthcare and wellness services.
492.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-5-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend By Three Years The Repealer On The Duty Of The Department Of Finance And Administration To Approve Or Disapprove The Private Lease Of The Robert G. Clark, Jr., State Office Building To An Entity Who Will Provide Healthcare And Wellness Services To State Employees; And For Related Purposes.

493.title: Sex-related/abstinence education and Teen Pregnancy Prevention Task Force; extend repealers on.
493.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend By Five Years The Repealer On The Provision Of Law Requiring Every School District To Adopt A Policy To Implement Abstinence-only Or Abstinence-plus Education Into Its Curriculum; To Abolish And Dissolve The Teen Pregnancy Prevention Task Force; And For Related Purposes.

494.title: Income tax; extend repealer on tax credit for certain charges for using certain port facilities.
494.description: An Act To Reenact And Amend Sections 27-7-22.7 And 27-7-22.9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide An Income Tax Credit For Income Taxpayers That Use Port Facilities At State, County And Municipal Ports For The Export Of Cargo And Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Report Annually To The Legislature Regarding The Impact Of Such Tax Credit; To Reflect The Name Change Of The State Tax Commission To The Department Of Revenue; To Amend Section 4, Chapter 492, Laws Of 1994, As Last Amended By Section 3, Chapter 377, Laws Of 2012, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Sections 27-7-22.7 And 27-7-22.9, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

495.title: Income tax; extend repeal date on tax credit for new cut and sew jobs in upholstered furniture manufacturing industry.
495.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes An Income Tax Credit For Enterprises That Own Or Operate Upholstered Household Furniture Manufacturing Facilities For Each Full-time Employee Employed By Such Enterprise In A New Cut And Sew Job, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Such Section; And For Related Purposes.

496.title: MAEP; extend repealer on requirement that certain absences be considered excused for purposes of average daily attendance.
496.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend By Three Years The Repealer On The Requirement That Certain Absences Be Considered For Calculated Average Daily Attendance Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

497.title: Group purchasing programs by certain public hospitals and regional mental health centers; extend repealer on authority to participate in.
497.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision That Authorizes Participation In Group Purchasing Programs By Certain Public Hospitals And Regional Mental Health Centers; And For Related Purposes.

498.title: Public Service Commission; extend repealers on its creation and authority to hire attorneys for certain proceedings.
498.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 77-1-1, 77-1-3, 77-1-5, 77-1-6, 77-1-11, 77-1-15, 77-1-17, 77-1-19, 77-1-21, 77-1-25, 77-1-27, 77-1-29, 77-1-31, 77-1-33, 77-1-35, 77-1-37, 77-1-39, 77-1-41, 77-1-43, 77-1-47 And 77-1-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Public Service Commission And Prescribe Its Powers And Duties; To Amend Section 77-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On Those Sections; To Amend Section 77-1-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On This Section Which Authorizes The Commission And The Public Utilities Staff To Hire Attorneys And Consultants For Certain Proceedings; And For Related Purposes.

499.title: Petroleum Products Inspection Law; extend repealers on definitions and penalties under.
499.description: An Act To Amend Sections 75-55-5 And 75-55-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Repealer On The Provisions Of Law Which Provide Definitions And Penalties Related To The Petroleum Products Inspection Laws; And For Related Purposes.

500.title: Pharmacy benefit managers; extend repealers on licensure statutes.
500.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-21-157 And 73-21-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On The Sections That Require The Licensure And The Financial Examination Of Pharmacy Benefit Managers; To Amend Sections 73-21-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Section Providing That The State Board Of Pharmacy Shall Regulate The Practice Of Pharmacy And Pharmacy Benefit Managers; To Amend Section 73-21-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Section Providing For License Renewal Fees For Pharmacists And Pharmacy Benefit Managers; And For Related Purposes.

501.title: State Board of Barber Examiners; extend repealer on.
501.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-5-1 Through 73-5-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The State Board Of Barber Examiners And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; To Amend Section 73-5-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provisions Of Law That Create The State Board Of Barber Examiners And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; And For Related Purposes.

502.title: State Board of Chiropractic Examiners; extend repealer on.
502.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-6-1 Through 73-6-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners And Regulate The Practice Of Chiropractic; To Amend Reenacted Section 73-6-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Some Minor Nonsubstantive Changes; To Amend Section 73-6-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On Those Sections; And For Related Purposes.

503.title: MS Auctioneers License Act; remove repealer.
503.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-4-1, 73-4-3, 73-4-5, 73-4-7, 73-4-9, 73-4-11, 73-4-13, 73-4-15, 73-4-17, 73-4-19, 73-4-21, 73-4-23, 73-4-25, 73-4-27, 73-4-29, 73-4-31, 73-4-33, 73-4-35, 73-4-37, 73-4-39, 73-4-41, 73-4-43, 73-4-45, 73-4-47, 73-4-49 And 73-4-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The "mississippi Auctioneers License Act"; To Amend Section 73-4-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Date Of Repeal Of Such Act; To Amend Section 73-4-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Some Minor Substantive Changes; And For Related Purposes.

504.title: Nonnative plant species; extend repealer on prohibition against planting potentially invasive types without a permit.
504.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-25-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend By Three Years The Repealer On The Provision Of Law Prohibiting The Cultivation Of Potentially Invasive Nonnative Plant Species Without A Permit; And For Related Purposes.

505.title: State Port authority; extend repealer on authority to use design-build method of contracting.
505.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-5-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The State Port Authority At Gulfport To Use The Design-build Method Of Contracting For Certain Purposes; To Extend The Date Of Repeal On This Section From July 1, 2016, To July 1, 2020; And For Related Purposes.

506.title: MS Delta Area Workforce Training Project; extend repealer on.
506.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 57-107-1 Through 57-107-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish The Mississippi Delta Area Workforce Training Project; To Repeal Section 39, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, Which Establishes A July 1, 2016, Repeal Date On Those Statutes That Create The Mississippi Delta Area Workforce Training Project; To Create New Section 57-107-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Place A Repealer On The Mississippi Delta Area Workforce Training Project In The Mississippi Code; And For Related Purposes.

507.title: Energy efficiency standards for buildings; extend repealer on statute requiring certain buildings to meet.
507.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-39-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires Certain Standards That Promote Efficient Energy Use To Be Implemented During The Design, Direction, Construction And Alteration Of Certain Buildings By Extending The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2016, To July 1, 2019; And For Related Purposes.

508.title: Criminal investigators; increase salary of.
508.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-31-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salary Of Criminal Investigators; To Bring Forward Section 25-31-10.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Supplemental Salary For Criminal Investigators, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 25-31-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Salary Of The Custodian Of The Office Of Criminal Records In Certain Areas, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 99-36-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Employment Of A Victim Assistance Coordinator In Certain Areas And Establishes The Compensation For The Position, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

509.title: Elected county officials; increase salaries of and make payments mandatory.
509.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-9-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of County Court Judges; To Amend Sections 23-15-153 And 23-15-239, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Per Diem That Commissioners Of Election Receive; To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Tax Assessors And Tax Collectors; To Amend Section 25-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of County Prosecuting Attorneys; To Amend Section 25-3-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of The Boards Of Supervisors; To Amend Section 25-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Sheriffs; To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of District Attorneys; To Amend Section 25-3-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Justice Court Judges; To Amend Section 9-19-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; To Amend Section 25-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fees Charged By County Surveyors; To Amend Section 37-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Per Diem For County School Board Members; To Amend Section 41-61-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of County Medical Examiners; To Bring Forward Sections 19-3-49, 19-5-171, 25-3-41, 25-3-69, 25-7-27 And 25-31-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

510.title: MS Consumer Protection in Eye Care Act of 2016; create.
510.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Consumer Protection In Eye Care Act Of 2016"; To Provide Definitions; To Provide That No Person May Dispense Contact Lenses Or Eyeglasses To A Patient Without A Prescription From A Licensed Physician Or Licensed Optometrist; To Provide That No Person Shall Operate A Kiosk To Conduct An Eye Assessment Or To Generate A Prescription For Contact Lenses Or Eyeglasses Unless The Diagnostic Information Is Read And Interpreted By A Licensed Physician Or Licensed Optometrist; To Provide Certain Standards For The Operation Of A Kiosk For An Eye Assessment; To Provide A Complaint Procedure For Violations Of This Act; To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Impose Civil Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Authorize A Private Right Of Action For Violations Of This Act; To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Issue Rules And Regulations In Consultation With The State Board Of Medical Licensure And The State Board Of Optometry To Implement The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 73-19-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

511.title: Hunting, fishing and trapping license; exempt records related to from Public Records Act.
511.description: An Act To Create New Section 49-7-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Records Of Hunting, Fishing And Trapping License Applications, Or Information Related To The Holders Of Such Licenses From The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983; And For Related Purposes.

512.title: Equal pay for equal work; require for employees of opposite sex in the same work establishment.
512.description: An Act To Provide That No Employer Shall Pay An Employee A Wage At A Rate Less Than The Rate At Which An Employee Of The Opposite Sex In The Same Establishment Is Paid For Equal Work On A Job, The Performance Of Which Requires Equal Skill, Effort And Responsibility, And Which Is Performed Under Similar Working Conditions; To Provide That An Employee May File A Petition In The Proper Circuit Court; And For Related Purposes.

513.title: Employee wages; require to be paid equally for women and men.
513.description: An Act To Provide That No Employer Shall Pay An Employee A Wage At A Rate Less Than The Rate At Which An Employee Of The Opposite Sex In The Same Establishment Is Paid For Equal Work On A Job, The Performance Of Which Requires Equal Skill, Effort And Responsibility, And Which Is Performed Under Similar Working Conditions; To Provide That An Employee May File A Petition In The Proper Circuit Court; And For Related Purposes.

514.title: Country of Origin Labels; clarify.
514.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-1-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify How A Retailer Is Required To Label The Country Of Origin On Covered Commodities; And For Related Purposes.

515.title: Automobile Liability Insurance; provide motorists noncompliant with may not recover noneconomic loss in accident with compliant motorist.
515.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Noncompliant Motorists For Automobile Liability Insurance Waive A Cause Of Action, And Otherwise May Not Collect, For Noneconomic Loss Against A Person Who Is In Compliance With The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety-responsibility Law Due To A Motor Vehicle Accident In Which The Driver Compliant For Automobile Liability Insurance Is Alleged To Be At Fault; And For Related Purposes.

516.title: Municipal minutes; revise how such shall be made valid.
516.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-15-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Procedure Of How Municipal Minutes Have The Legal Effect Of Being Valid After A Certain Time Period; And For Related Purposes.

517.title: Powdered alcohol; prohibit in this state.
517.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "alcoholic Beverage" Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law To Provide That The Term Does Not Include Powdered Alcohol; To Define The Term "powdered Alcohol" Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; To Amend Sections 67-1-9 And 67-1-17, To Provide That Powdered Alcohol Is Prohibited In This State And May Not Lawfully Be Manufactured, Mixed, Processed, Sold, Possessed, Imported Into The State, Exported From The State, Transported, Distributed, Warehoused Or Stored In This State, And That Powdered Alcohol Is Subject To Seizure By The Department Of Revenue And Forfeiture; To Amend Sections 67-1-18, 67-1-72, 67-1-93, 67-1-95, 67-1-97 And 67-1-99, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

518.title: MS Unborn Child Protection from Dismemberment Abortion Act; create.
518.description: An Act To Be Known As The Mississippi Unborn Child Protection From Dismemberment Abortion Act; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide That It Is Unlawful For Any Person To Purposely Perform Or Attempt To Perform A Dismemberment Abortion And Thereby Kill An Unborn Child Unless Necessary To Prevent Serious Health Risk To The Unborn Child's Mother; To Authorize Injunctions To Prevent Dismemberment Abortions; To Authorize A Cause Of Action For Civil Damages Against Persons Who Have Performed Dismemberment Abortions; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Provide For The Protection Of Privacy In Court Proceedings For Women Upon Whom An Abortion Has Been Performed; And For Related Purposes.

519.title: Employees of Department of Corrections; double penalties upon conviction of providing contraband items to offenders.
519.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-192, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Penalties Shall Be Doubled For Department Of Corrections Employees Or Contract Employees Of The Department When Such Employees Violate Authorized Rules Promulgated By The Commissioner Of Corrections Related To Contraband Items; To Amend Section 47-5-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Penalties Shall Be Doubled Upon Conviction When Such Employees Provide Offenders With Contraband Items; And For Related Purposes.

520.title: All-terrain vehicles; require retailers to maintain certain records of.
520.description: An Act To Require Retailers To Maintain Certain Records On All-terrain And Off-road Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

521.title: All-terrain vehicles; clarify inclusion in chop shop act to prohibit altering of VIN.
521.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-25-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That All-terrain Vehicles And Off-road Vehicles Are Motor Vehicles For The Purposes Of The Motor Vehicle Chop Shop, Stolen And Altered Property Act, Which Makes It Illegal To Alter A Vehicle Identification Number; And For Related Purposes.

522.title: Workers' Compensation Assigned Risk Plan; revise laws regarding.
522.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, Whenever A Policy Is Purchased Under The Mississippi Assigned Risk Pool And A Minimum Premium Applies To The Policy, The Insurer Shall Provide Written Notice To The Insured That The Minimum Premium Is Fully Earned; To Provide That Any Employer Or Person Affected By The Operation Of The Mississippi Workers' Compensation Assigned Risk Plan Or The Actions Of A Servicing Carrier Of The Plan Who Has A Dispute With Respect To Any Aspect Of The Plan Or The Actions Of A Servicing Carrier Of The Plan Shall Exhaust All Administrative Dispute Resolution Remedies Provided For In The Plan Prior To Commencement Of A Civil Action Against Any Servicing Carrier Of The Plan; And For Related Purposes.

523.title: Counties that do not have certain financial info. available; authorize State Auditor to impose certain penalties against.
523.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Counties A Remedy For Damages Caused To The Counties By The Clerks Of County Boards Of Supervisors Who Fail To Comply With The Prescribed Method Of Uniform Budget Reporting As Set Out By The State Auditor; To Create New Section 19-11-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Upon Notice From The State Auditor Of The Time Period Of The Audit, The Boards Of Supervisors For Each County Shall Provide Certain Required Information Within A Reasonable Period Of Time And In The Manner Prescribed By Law; To Provide The State Auditor With Certain Remedies Against County Boards Of Supervisors For Noncompliance With Uniform Budget Reporting Or An Inability To Provide The Required Information In A Timely Manner; And For Related Purposes.

524.title: Certificate of insurance; require after certain dl suspensions and damages caused.
524.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Certificate Of Insurance Be Provided To The Department Of Public Safety To Reinstate A Driver's License That Has Been Suspended Under The Implied Consent Laws; To Amend Section 63-15-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Required Provisions Of A Motor Vehicle Liability Policy; To Amend Section 63-15-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Notice Requirements When A Certified Policy Is Amended; To Amend Section 63-15-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Department Of Public Safety May Not Require Fees From Insurance Companies For The Administration Of The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety-responsibility Law; And For Related Purposes.

525.title: Mortgages; establish foreclosure procedures giving borrowers a chance to modify their loans first.
525.description: An Act To Establish Procedures For The Foreclosure Of Mortgages By Advertisement Under Which A Borrower Must Be Given An Opportunity To Meet With A Lender Regarding Modification Of A Mortgage Loan On A Principal Residence Before Foreclosure Proceedings May Be Begun; To Prohibit A Party From Beginning Foreclosure Proceedings By Advertisement If The Prescribed Procedures Have Not Been Followed Or The Applicable Time Limits Have Not Expired, Or If The Parties Have Agreed To Modify The Loan And The Borrower Is Not In Default; To Require A Foreclosing Party, Before Proceeding With A Foreclosure Sale By Advertisement, To Mail To The Borrower A Written Notice Containing Specified Information, Including The Name Of A Designated Contact Person Who Will Have The Authority To Make Modification Agreements And A List Of Approved Housing Counselors; To Allow The Borrower To Bring An Action To Enjoin The Foreclosure If The Required Notice Was Not Served; To Require The Borrower To Contact A Housing Counselor If He Or She Wishes To Work Out A Modification, And Require The Counselor To Schedule A Meeting With The Designated Contact Person; To Provide That Foreclosure Proceedings May Not Be Begun Until 90 Days After The Notice Was Sent, If The Borrower Requests A Meeting; To Require The Borrower, The Designated Person, Or The Housing Counselor To Calculate A Modified Payment If The Meeting Does Not Result In An Agreement; To Require The Mississippi Home Corporation To Prepare A List Of Approved Housing Counselors; To Amend Sections 89-1-55 And 89-1-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

526.title: Mortgages; establish alternative foreclosure procedures giving borrowers a chance to modify their loans first.
526.description: An Act To Establish, As An Alternative To Any Other Foreclosure Procedure Authorized By Law, Procedures For The Foreclosure Of Mortgages By Advertisement Under Which A Borrower Must Be Given An Opportunity To Meet With A Lender Regarding Modification Of A Mortgage Loan On A Principal Residence Before Foreclosure Proceedings May Be Begun; To Prohibit A Party From Beginning Foreclosure Proceedings By Advertisement If The Prescribed Procedures Have Not Been Followed Or The Applicable Time Limits Have Not Expired, Or If The Parties Have Agreed To Modify The Loan And The Borrower Is Not In Default; To Require A Foreclosing Party, Before Proceeding With A Foreclosure Sale By Advertisement, To Mail To The Borrower A Written Notice Containing Specified Information, Including The Name Of A Designated Contact Person Who Will Have The Authority To Make Modification Agreements And A List Of Approved Housing Counselors; To Allow The Borrower To Bring An Action To Enjoin The Foreclosure If The Required Notice Was Not Served; To Require The Borrower To Contact A Housing Counselor If He Or She Wishes To Work Out A Modification, And Require The Counselor To Schedule A Meeting With The Designated Contact Person; To Provide That Foreclosure Proceedings May Not Be Begun Until 90 Days After The Notice Was Sent, If The Borrower Requests A Meeting; To Require The Borrower, The Designated Person, Or The Housing Counselor To Calculate A Modified Payment If The Meeting Does Not Result In An Agreement; To Require The Mississippi Home Corporation To Prepare A List Of Approved Housing Counselors; To Amend Sections 89-1-55 And 89-1-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

527.title: DUI; revise penalty for second or subsequent offense of driving with suspended license.
527.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Enhanced Penalties For Second Or Subsequent Offenses Of Driving With A Driver's License That Has Been Cancelled, Suspended Or Revoked For Driving Under The Influence Violations; And For Related Purposes.

528.title: MDOT law enforcement officers; authorize to enforce implied consent law.
528.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Law Enforcement Officers Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Administer Chemical Tests Under The Implied Consent Law; And For Related Purposes.

529.title: Nursing homes; require to purchase and maintain a minimum amount of liability insurance.
529.description: An Act To Require Nursing Homes To Purchase And Maintain A Certain Minimum Amount Of Liability Insurance; To Amend Sections 43-11-7 And 43-11-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

530.title: Unborn Infants Dignity Act; create.
530.description: An Act To Create The Unborn Infants Dignity Act; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Require The Release Of Certain Remains To The Mother Upon Request; To Require A Mother Or Her Authorized Representative To Provide A Written Authorization For The Final Disposition Of Certain Remains; To Provide For Fetal Death Certificates; To Prohibit The Buying, Selling And Experimentation On Unborn Infants Or Bodily Remains Resulting From Abortion; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Violations Of This Act; To Provide Civil Remedies For Certain Violations Of This Act; To Amend Sections 73-25-29, 41-39-1 And 41-39-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

531.title: Motorcycles; authorize to proceed through stalled traffic using portion of left and right lanes on four lane road.
531.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-603, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Motorcycles To Lane Split In Certain Circumstances; To Provide That Lane Splitting Shall Not Be Allowed Unless Traffic Is Proceeding At A Rate Of Speed Less Than 30 Miles Per Hour; To Provide That Drivers Or Passengers Impeding A Motorcycle That Is Lane Splitting May Be Subject To A Misdemeanor; And For Related Purposes.

532.title: Motorcycles; authorize to proceed through red light if green light is not triggered.
532.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Motorcycles And Certain Other Vehicles To Proceed Through Intersections Or Make A Turn When Stopped At A Red Light, If Such Vehicle Does Not Trigger The Sensor For A Green Light; And For Related Purposes.

533.title: Motorcycle; authorize to proceed through red light if green light is not triggered.
533.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Motorcycles And Certain Other Vehicles To Proceed Through Intersections Or Make A Turn When Stopped At A Red Light, If Such Vehicle Does Not Trigger The Sensor For A Green Light; And For Related Purposes.

534.title: Radar; authorize sheriff and deputy sheriffs to use on county roads to enforce speed limits.
534.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Sheriff And His Deputies In Any County To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon The Public Streets, Roads And Highways Of The County Lying Outside Of The Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

535.title: Ammunition; require record-keeping of sales.
535.description: An Act To Require Record-keeping Of Sales Of Pistol Or Rifle Cartridges; To Amend Section 97-37-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

536.title: Forestry Commission enforcement officers; provide with full police power as a duly sworn law enforcement officer.
536.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-19-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Full Police Powers To Law Enforcement Officers Of The Mississippi Forestry Commission; To Require Such Officers To Complete The Law Enforcement Training Academy Or Equivalent Training Program; To Require The Commission To Maintain A Complete Record Of All Law Enforcement Training Of Each Employee In His Or Her Record Of Employment; To Prescribe The Powers, Duties And Required Responsibilities Of Such Officers; And For Related Purposes.

537.title: Recreational firearms; require to be stored in same manner as other firearms.
537.description: An Act To Create New Section 97-37-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Persons Engaged In The Business Of Dealing Or Selling Firearms To Store Bb Guns And Compressed Air Recreational Firearms In The Same Manner; And For Related Purposes.

538.title: Burglary; enhanced penalties for repeat offenders.
538.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Enhanced Penalties For A Second And Third Or Subsequent Offense Of Burglary; And For Related Purposes.

539.title: Death penalty; prohibit imposition when based solely on circumstantial evidence.
539.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Death Penalty Shall Not Be Imposed When A Conviction Is Based Solely On Circumstantial Evidence; And For Related Purposes.

540.title: Weapons; prohibit discharge near petroleum products.
540.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Discharge Of Firearms Near Property Where Petroleum Products Are Located; And For Related Purposes.

541.title: Firearms; authorize to be carried at highway welcome centers and rest areas.
541.description: An Act To Amend Sections 45-9-101 And 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Carrying Of Certain Firearms At Highway Welcome Centers And Rest Areas; And For Related Purposes.

542.title: Theft; revise penalty when employee gives away merchandise.
542.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-23-99, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense And Penalties Regarding The Giving Away Of Merchandise By An Employee Without Authorization Of The Merchant; And For Related Purposes.

543.title: Identity theft; establish procedure for victim to have debt forgiven and credit reports purged.
543.description: An Act To Establish A Procedure For A Victim Of Identity Theft To Have The Debt Forgiven And Credit Reports Purged; And For Related Purposes.

544.title: Death by law enforcement officer; require independent investigations of.
544.description: An Act To Require Each Local Law Enforcement Agency To Adopt A Policy Regarding The Investigation Process Of Any Death Resulting From The Involvement Of An Officer Employed By The Law Enforcement Agency; To Provide That Such Policy Shall Be Provided To And Signed By All Law Enforcement Officers Employed By The Law Enforcement Agency To Acknowledge Receipt Of The Policy; To Provide That The Investigation Process Shall Be Conducted By Internal Affairs In A Transparent Manner That Avoids Any Appearance Of Any Conflict Of Interest; To Prescribe The Minimum Criteria To Be Contained In The Policy; To Provide That The Occurrence Of Certain Acts Shall Necessitate An Immediate Response To The Scene Of Incident And An Investigation Conducted By Internal Affairs; To Require The Investigator Conducting The Investigation To Provide A Complete Written Report To The Attorney General And The District Attorney Of The County In Which The Officer-involved Death Or Injury Occurred; To Provide That The Investigation Of Such Incidents Shall Not Exceed Six Months; And For Related Purposes.

545.title: Felony expungement; authorize for first time offenses.
545.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of Second And Subsequent Offense For Certain Crimes; To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Felony Offenses Which May Be Expunged; And For Related Purposes.

546.title: Murder; authorize lesser offense to be charged.
546.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charges Of Capital Murder, First-degree Murder And Second-degree Murder Shall Be Sufficient To Charge For The Lesser Offense Of Manslaughter; And For Related Purposes.

547.title: "Scarlet Letter DUI License Plate Act"; create.
547.description: An Act To Create The "scarlet Letter Driving Under The Influence License Plate Act"; To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Second Dui Offender To Obtain A Restricted License Plate On Each Vehicle With An Ignition Interlock Device; To Amend Section 63-11-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Design A Yellow License Plate With Red Letters Or Numbers To Be Used As A Restricted Dui License Plate Or Tag; To Bring Forward Section 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Fees For Reinstatement Of Licenses, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

548.title: All-terrain vehicles; establish ownership registration network for.
548.description: An Act To Require The Owner Of An All-terrain Vehicle To Register The Vehicle With The Sheriff's Department Of The County Of His Or Her Residence; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Establish A Statewide All-terrain Vehicle Registration Network Designed To Provide Immediate Response To Sheriffs' Departments And Law Enforcement Agencies With Regard To Reports Or Complaints Involving All-terrain Vehicles; To Provide For The Collection And Disposition Of Fees For Operation And Maintenance Of The Network; And For Related Purposes.

549.title: Life jackets; increase minimum age of person required to wear on certain vessels.
549.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-21-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From Twelve To Eighteen The Minimum Age For A Person Who Is Required To Wear A Coast Guard Approved Personal Flotation Device While On Board Certain Motorboats, Sailboats Or Vessels; To Amend Section 59-21-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $250.00 To $500.00 The Maximum Penalty For Violations Of The Mississippi Boating Law; And For Related Purposes.

550.title: Radar; authorize MDOT law enforcement to use when enforcing speed limit laws on commercial vehicles.
550.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Office Of Law Enforcement To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment On Commercial Motor Vehicles That They Are Authorized To Inspect For Safe Operation And Safe Use Of; To Amend Section 77-7-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Enforce Speed Limit Laws On Commercial Vehicles; To Amend Section 77-7-335, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Mississippi Department Of Transportation Law Enforcement Officers To Enforce Speed Limit Laws On Commercial Vehicles; To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Mississippi Department Of Transportation Law Enforcement Officers To Comply With The Uniform Traffic Ticket Law When Issuing Tickets For The Violation Of Speed Laws To Commercial Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

551.title: Contributing to the neglect or delinquency of a child and abuse of a child; revise penalties for.
551.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Contributing To The Neglect Or Delinquency Of Any Child, Abuse Of A Child, Aiding In The Escape Of A Child Under Certain Circumstances Or Aiding In The Harboring Or Concealing Of A Child Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

552.title: Human trafficking; increase penalty and authorize center for violence prevention.
552.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-54.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Penalty For Human Trafficking; To Designating The Center For Violence Prevention As The Lead Organization To Facilitate A Victim-centered, Collaborative, Statewide Response To Victims Of Human Trafficking, As Well As Missing, Runaway, And Endangered Children; To Provide That Any Person, Except A Parent Or Guardian, Who Knowingly Causes A Child To Violate The Uniform Controlled Substance Law Or To Participate In Gangs Or Gang Related Activities Or Otherwise Contributes To The Delinquency Of A Minor Shall Be Guilty Of A Felony And Punished By Imprisonment Of Not Less Than Ten Years Or By A Fine Not To Exceed Ten Thousand Dollars, Or Both; To Require A Minimum Ten Year Imprisonment Or Payment Of A Fine Of Not More Than Ten Thousand Dollars, Or Both, For Any Person, Except A Parent, Legal Guardian Or Caretaker, Who Endangers A Child's Person Or Health By Knowingly Causing Or Permitting The Child To Be Present Where Any Person Is Selling, Manufacturing Or Possessing Immediate Precursors Or Chemical Substances With Intent To Manufacture, Sell Or Possess A Controlled Substance As Prohibited Under Section 41-29-139 Or 41-29-313; To Increase The Age Of A Minor Child From Eighteen Years Old To Twenty-one Years Old For The Purposes Of Contributing To The Delinquency Of A Minor As Provided In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

553.title: Firearms silencers; bring forward section of law that regulates.
553.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 97-37-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Regulates Firearm Silencers, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

554.title: Felony expungement; revise age.
554.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Age For Expunction Of Certain Felonies; To Amend Section 21-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

555.title: Expunction; revise.
555.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-23-7 And 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Expunction Of Certain Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

556.title: Biological evidence; delete provision requiring preservation of certain, to eliminate conflict between sections.
556.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-49-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision That Requires The State To Preserve The Biological Evidence Taken In Tests For Hiv/aids Of Persons Arrested For The Commission Of A Sex Crime Against A Minor, Which Conflicts With The Provision Of Section 99-3-41 That Requires The Biological Sample To Be Destroyed; And For Related Purposes.

557.title: Armed robbery; revise penalty of imprisonment for those convicted of.
557.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty From Life To Not Less Than Ten Years To Life When An Individual Is Convicted Of Armed Robbery; And For Related Purposes.

558.title: Witness protection program; create.
558.description: An Act To Create A Witness Protection Program In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For The Appointment Of The Witness Protection Board; To Require Witness Protection Agreements; To Amend Section 25-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Exclusion Of Witness Protection From Public Meetings; And For Related Purposes.

559.title: Law enforcement; require pursuit policy of alleged crime perpetrator.
559.description: An Act To Require County And Local Law Enforcement Agencies That Authorizes Vehicular Pursuits To Adopt Written Policies That Set Forth The Manner In Which These Operations Shall Be Conducted; And For Related Purposes.

560.title: Firearms; revise limits placed on counties and municipalities to regulate.
560.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Limitations Placed On Counties And Municipalities To Regulate The Carrying Of Firearms; To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Authority Of A Concealed License Holder To Enter Certain Buildings; To Bring Forward Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Firearms Permits, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

561.title: Accident reports; create penalty for providing false information to law enforcement.
561.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-405, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Offense Of Providing False Information In An Accident Report And Provide Penalties For Violations; To Amend Section 97-35-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

562.title: Indecent Assault; create crime of.
562.description: An Act To Create New Section 97-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Crime Of Indecent Assault; To Provide Penalties For Violation Of Such Crime; To Provide That This Provision Of Law Shall Be Not Construed To Prevent, Limit Or Restrict Prosecution And Conviction Of Any Person Under Any Other Provision Of Law; And For Related Purposes.

563.title: Adoption; revise home study and residency requirements.
563.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-17-3 And 93-17-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Judge To Determine If A Home Study Is Necessary In An Adoption; To Clarify Residency Requirements; To Amend Section 93-17-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Persons Who Disclose Information Received During Closed Adoption Hearings Or From Records Pertaining To Adoption Proceedings Are Guilty Of A Misdemeanor, Subject To Being Fined Or Imprisoned, And May Be Held In Contempt Of Court; And For Related Purposes.

564.title: Motor vehicle; impose felony for operation of with a suspended license due to second or subsequent DUI violation.
564.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Who Drives Any Motor Vehicle While Their License Is Suspended As A Result Of A Second Or Subsequent Conviction Of Operation Under The Influence Shall Be Guilty Of A Felony; And For Related Purposes.

565.title: State Prosecutor Education Fund; increase assessment for traffic violations.
565.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The State Prosecutor Education Fund Assessment That Is Imposed For Traffic Violations; And For Related Purposes.

566.title: MS Forensics Lab; lab analysis fee in criminal cases shall be imposed in misdemeanor cases as well as felony cases.
566.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-1-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Laboratory Analysis Fee Imposed By The Courts Upon Certain Individuals In Criminal Cases Where The Mississippi Forensics Laboratory Provided Forensic Science Or Laboratory Services In Connection With The Case Shall Be Imposed Upon Individuals Convicted Of Misdemeanors In Addition To Individuals Convicted Of Felonies; And For Related Purposes.

567.title: Concealed weapon license; require court/mental treatment facilities to notify Department of Public Safety.
567.description: An Act To Provide That If A Court Adjudicates A Person As Mentally Incompetent Or Orders That A Person Be Committed To A Hospital, Mental Health Treatment Facility Or Other Institution Qualified To Provide Care And Treatment For Persons With Mental Illness, Then The Clerk Of Court Shall Notify The Department Of Public Safety Of Such Order; To Provide That If A Person Voluntarily Commits Himself Or Herself To Such A Hospital, Facility Or Institution, Then The Hospital, Facility Or Institution Shall Notify The Department Of Public Safety; To Provide That The Department May Use The Information Contained In The Notification Solely For Purposes Associated With Issuing, Denying, Suspending Or Revoking Such Person's License, Or Application For A License To Carry A Stun Gun, Concealed Pistol Or Concealed Revolver; To Provide That Records Associated With This Information Are Not Public; To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Require That The Department Maintain An Automated Listing Of Persons Who Are The Subject Of Such Notifications And Review The Listing As Necessary; And For Related Purposes.

568.title: Vulnerable person; abuse of is a felony, not misdemeanor, and reckless abuse is also included.
568.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-47-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Abuse Of A Vulnerable Person Is A Felony Instead Of A Misdemeanor; To Provide That A Person Is Guilty Of Abusing A Vulnerable Person If The Act Or Omission That Causes The Abuse Was Done Recklessly, Not Just Willfully; And For Related Purposes.

569.title: Firearms; restrict access from persons who are mentally incompetent.
569.description: An Act To Provide That If A Court Adjudicates A Person As Mentally Incompetent Or Orders That A Person Be Committed To A Hospital, Mental Health Treatment Facility Or Other Institution Qualified To Provide Care And Treatment For Persons With Mental Illness, Then The Clerk Of Court Shall Notify The Department Of Public Safety Of Such Order; To Provide That If A Person Voluntarily Commits Himself Or Herself To Such A Hospital, Facility Or Institution, Then The Hospital, Facility Or Institution Shall Notify The Department Of Public Safety; To Provide That The Department May Use The Information Contained In The Notification Solely For Purposes Associated With Issuing, Denying, Suspending Or Revoking Such Person's License, Or Application For A License To Carry A Stun Gun, Concealed Pistol Or Concealed Revolver; To Provide That Records Associated With This Information Are Not Public; To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Require That The Department Maintain An Automated Listing Of Persons Who Are The Subject Of Such Notifications And Review The Listing As Necessary; And For Related Purposes.

570.title: Firearms; clarify meaning of courthouse and courtroom for purpose of carrying.
570.description: An Act To Amend Sections 45-9-101 And 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Meaning Of The Words, Courthouse And Courtroom, Within The Provisions Of Law Regulating The Carrying Of Firearms; And For Related Purposes.

571.title: Sexual battery; conform statute of limitation to rape.
571.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Passage Of Time Will Not Bar Prosecution For Sexual Battery Without Regard To The Age Of The Victim; And For Related Purposes.

572.title: Crime; create for accidents caused by drivers of stolen vehicles.
572.description: An Act To Create A Criminal Offense For Causing An Accident While Using A Motor Vehicle Unlawfully Taken; And For Related Purposes.

573.title: Shoplifting; revise penalties.
573.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-23-93, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Value Of Shoplifted Merchandise Required For Certain Penalties Under The Shoplifting Law; To Provide That A Prosecutor May Aggregate The Value Of Merchandise Shoplifted Within The Same Legal Jurisdiction; And For Related Purposes.

574.title: Crimes; revise penalties for fraudulent use of identity of another.
574.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-19-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties For The Fraudulent Use Of The Identity Of Another; And For Related Purposes.

575.title: Rape; death penalty for conviction if victim is age 13 or under.
575.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Death Penalty In Statutory Rape Cases Where The Victim Is 13 Years Of Age Or Under And The Defendant Is 18 Years Of Age Or Older; And For Related Purposes.

576.title: Crimes of violence; expand types of burglary that are included in.
576.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Types Of Burglary Crimes That Are Included In The List Of Crimes Of Violence; And For Related Purposes.

577.title: Mississippi See Something, Say Something Act of 2016; enact.
577.description: An Act To Create The See Something, Say Something Act; To Create New Section 95-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Immunity From Liability For Good Faith Reporting Of Suspicious Activity Or Behavior; And For Related Purposes.

578.title: Indecent assault; create the crime of.
578.description: An Act To Create New Section 97-3-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Crime Of Indecent Assault; And For Related Purposes.

579.title: Public schools; clarify authority of local law enforcement agencies to prevent and investigate crimes on property of in their jurisdiction.
579.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-323, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of Local Law Enforcement Agencies And Their Sworn Law Enforcement Officers To Prevent And Investigate Criminal Activity And Violation Of Law On School Property In School Districts Wherein Such Agencies' Police Power Jurisdiction Lies; And For Related Purposes.

580.title: Mississippi Employee Firearm Protection Act of 2016; create.
580.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Employee Firearm Protection Act Of 2016; To Amend Section 45-9-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A Public Or Private Employer From Restricting An Employee's Possession Of A Firearm In The Employee's Privately Owned Motor Vehicle While Parked In A Public Or Private Parking Area; To Require The Employee To Possess A Valid Concealed Carry Permit Or Mississippi Hunting License; To Provide That The Firearm Must Be Kept In The Employee's Motor Vehicle And Kept From Ordinary Observation; To Authorize An Employer To Make Inquiry Into Whether An Employee Possesses A Firearm In Their Motor Vehicle Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide That An Employer May Not Take Adverse Action Against An Employee If The Employee Has Complied With The Requirements Of This Section; To Provide Recovery Against The Employer If The Employer Has Wrongfully Taken Adverse Action Against An Employee; And For Related Purposes.

581.title: Drone Regulation Act; create.
581.description: An Act To Create The "drone Regulation Act"; To Provide Definitions For Such Act; To Regulate The Use Of Drones In The Capturing Of Images; And For Related Purposes.

582.title: Nonviolent offenders; authorize reduction of sentences for passage of end-of-course subject area tests by the offenders.
582.description: An Act To Provide That A Nonviolent Offender Who Is Incarcerated By The Department Of Corrections Shall Have His Or Her Sentence Reduced By A Certain Percentage If Such Person Passes Subjects Of The Mississippi End-of-course Subject Area Testing Program; To Amend Sections 47-5-138 And 47-5-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

583.title: Transportation; transfer law enforcement duties of MDOT to the Department of Public Safety.
583.description: An Act To Transfer Law Enforcement Personnel And Law Enforcement Duties Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation Related To The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law To The Motor Carrier Division Of The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Within The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety; Amend Sections 77-7-16 And 45-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 25-13-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude Transferred Personnel From The Highway Safety Patrol Retirement System; To Amend Section 77-1-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement To Appropriate Funds To The Public Service Commission To Carry Out The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law; To Repeal Section 77-1-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Employment Of Personnel By The Public Service Commission To Enforce The Motor Carrier Regulatory Law; To Repeal Section 77-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Transfer Of Law Enforcement Personnel To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation From The Public Service Commission; And For Related Purposes.

584.title: Technical violations for offender; require sentence to run concurrently for each violation report.
584.description: An Act To Amend Sections 47-7-27 And 47-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Whenever An Offender Is Placed In A Technical Violation Center For A Violation Report, The Term Of Imprisonment For The Offender In The Center Shall Run Concurrently And Not Consecutively; And For Related Purposes.

585.title: Marriage; provide that members of the judiciary and boards of supervisors are not required to officiate marriages if that would violate religious beliefs.
585.description: An Act To Provide That Members Of The Judiciary And Boards Of Supervisors Authorized To Officiate Rites Of Matrimony Shall Not Be Required To Do So If Such Action Would Violate A Sincerely Held Religious Belief; And For Related Purposes.

586.title: Marriage; provide that certain religious organizations and individuals shall not be required to officiate if that would violate beliefs.
586.description: An Act To Provide That Religious Organizations, Clergy, Ministers And Certain Individuals Shall Not Be Required To Officiate Any Marriage Or Provide Services If That Action Would Cause The Organization Or Individual To Violate A Sincerely Held Religious Belief; To Provide That The Refusal To Solemnize Any Marriage Or Provide Services Based On A Religious Belief Is Not The Basis For A Civil Or Criminal Cause Of Action And Protected Organizations Or Individuals Shall Not Be Penalized Or Have Benefits Withheld For Refusing Such Services; And For Related Purposes.

587.title: Domestic Abuse Protective Orders; expand authority of.
587.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-21-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Wide-ranging Application Of Emergency Domestic Abuse Protection Orders; To Amend Section 93-21-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Wide-ranging Application Of Other Domestic Abuse Protection Orders; To Create New Section 93-21-15.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Appellate Procedures For Appeals Of Domestic Abuse Protection Orders, And To Specify When Such Appeals Are On The Record Or Are De Novo; And For Related Purposes.

588.title: Voluntary search; require peace officer to obtain written consent before effectuating.
588.description: An Act To Require Law Enforcement Officers To Obtain Written Consent From A Person Before Subjecting Such Person To A Voluntary Search; To Provide That This Section Only Applies To Voluntary Searches Where There Is No Legal Basis For A Search; And For Related Purposes.

589.title: False report of child abuse; provide criminal penalties and civil liability.
589.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-35-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The False Report Of Child Abuse Or Neglect To The Department Of Human Services Shall Be Punishable As A Misdemeanor; To Provide That A Person Who Knowingly And Willfully Makes A False Report Of Child Abuse Or Neglect May Be Civilly Liable For Damages Suffered Including Reasonable Attorney Fees And Costs; And For Related Purposes.

590.title: Sanctuary cities; prohibit the establishment of.
590.description: An Act To Prohibit The Establishment Of Sanctuary Cities; To Authorize All Mississippi Law Enforcement Officers To Assist Federal Agencies In Enforcement Of Immigration Law; To Require Cooperation And Assistance In Enforcement Of Immigration Laws And To Indemnify Law Enforcement Officers For Implementation Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

591.title: Concealed weapon; authorize reduce fees for certain older persons.
591.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Exceptions To The Concealed Weapon License Law For The Benefit Of License Applicants Who Are 65 Years Of Age Or Older; To Set The License Fee For Such Applicants At Twenty-five Dollars; To Allow Such Applicants To Have Their Fingerprints Taken At Any Office Of The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol, For A Maximum Fee Of Five Dollars; To Provide That Such Applicants Shall Immediately Have Their Fingerprints Processed, Background Checks Conducted, Required Notifications To Local Law Enforcement Officers Made, And Their Licenses Issued Or Denied, At The Location Where The Fingerprints Were Taken; And For Related Purposes.

592.title: First Degree Murder; reduce penalty for conviction of.
592.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Penalty For Persons Convicted Of First Degree Murder; And For Related Purposes.

593.title: Capital murder; include the murder of an uniformed security guard as.
593.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Killing Of An Uniformed Security Guard Shall Be Considered Capital Murder; And For Related Purposes.

594.title: Cargo theft; provide for crime and penalties of.
594.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Crime Of Cargo Theft; To Provide For Certain Definitions; To Provide Penalties; To Provide For The Crime Of Unlawful Possession Or Use Of A Fifth Wheel; To Amend Section 97-25-25, In Conformity With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

595.title: Littering; provide mandatory penalty when such occurs on church property.
595.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Mandatory Fine For Littering On Property Owned, Controlled Or Regulated By A Church Or Place Of Worship; And For Related Purposes.

596.title: Littering; increase fine to $500.00 per violation.
596.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fine For Littering; And For Related Purposes.

597.title: Firearm crimes; provide penalty for shooting into occupied facilities.
597.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-25-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Separate Crime Of Shooting Into Occupied Certain Transportation Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

598.title: Witness Protection Program; authorize.
598.description: An Act To Create A Witness Protection Program In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For The Appointment Of The Witness Protection Board; To Require Witness Protection Agreements; To Amend Section 25-41-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Exclusion Of Witness Protection Agreements From The Public Record; To Provide Penalties For Harassment And Murder Of A Witness; To Authorize The Creation Of A Mental Health Court Program By The Circuit Courts; To Provide Conditions For Eligibility For Participation In A Mental Health Court Program; To Task The Administrative Office Of Courts With Supervisory Responsibility; To Require The State Drug Court Advisory Committee To Develop Statewide Rules And Policies For Mental Health Treatment Courts; To Specify Funds For The Mental Health Courts; To Provide Immunity Of The Staff Members Of Veterans Treatment Courts For Their Good Faith Acts; And For Related Purposes.

599.title: Firearms permits; revise renewal process.
