1557.description: An Act To Establish A Local Governments Mswin Infrastructure And Equipment Revolving Loan Program For The Purpose Of Assisting Counties And Municipalities In Making Purchases That Are Needed To Be Able To Participate In The Mississippi Wireless Information Network (mswin); To Provide That The Program Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Define "mswin Participation Purchases" For The Purposes Of The Loan Program; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury, Designated As The "local Governments Mswin Infrastructure And Equipment Revolving Loan Fund"; To Prescribe The Manner In Which Funds Under This Act May Be Made Available To And Expended By Counties And Municipalities; To Prescribe The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Development Authority Under The Provisions Of This Act; To Provide For The Issuance Of Not More Than $20,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Fund The Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1558.title: Sales tax; revise provisions regarding erroneous diversion to municipalities.
1558.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If The Department Of Revenue Has Made Erroneous Disbursements To A Municipality As A Diversion Of Sales Tax Revenue For A Period Of Three Years Or More, The Maximum Amount That May Be Recovered Or Withheld From The Municipality Is The Total Amount Of Funds Erroneously Disbursed For A Period Of Three Years Beginning With The Date Of The First Erroneous Disbursement; To Provide That If During Such Period, A Municipality Provides Written Notice To The Department Of Revenue Indicating The Erroneous Disbursement Of Funds, Then The Maximum Amount That May Be Recovered Or Withheld From The Municipality Is The Total Amount Of Funds Erroneously Disbursed For A Period Of One Year Beginning With The Date Of The First Erroneous Disbursement; To Bring Forward Sections 27-65-51 And 27-65-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To The Refund Of Sales Tax That Is Overpaid Or Improperly Collected, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1559.title: Ad valorem taxes; list of personal; property provided to tax assessor is presumed to be accurate.
1559.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-35-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Case Of A Taxpayer That Is A Small Business, The List Of A Taxpayer's Personal Property That The Taxpayer Provides To The Tax Assessor Shall Be Presumed To Be Accurate, And The Tax Assessor Shall Use The List For The Purpose Of Determining The True Value Of The Personal Property Unless The Assessor Has Reason To Believe That The List Does Not Accurately Reflect The Extent Of The Taxpayer's Personal Property And The Value Of The Property; To Define The Term "small Business"; And For Related Purposes.

1560.title: Income tax and sales tax; revise method of collecting from officers and employees of the state and political subdivisions.
1560.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-7-45 And 27-7-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Provisions That Provide That If Any Officer Or Employee Of The State, Or Any Political Subdivision Thereof, Does Not Pay State Income Tax By August 15 After The Tax Becomes Due And Payable, That His Wages, Salary Or Other Compensation Shall Be Withheld And Paid To The Department Of Revenue Until The Tax Is Paid In Full; To Provide That The Department Of Revenue May Pursue All Remedies For Collection That Are Available To It In The Collection Of Income Tax Owed By Persons Who Are Not Public Officers Or Employees; To Provide That Any Attachment Or Garnishment Made Against Such Public Officer Or Employee Shall Be For An Amount Of 25% Of The Officer's Or Employee's Disposable Earnings Or The Amount Of The Outstanding Tax Liability, Whichever Is Less; To Amend Section 27-65-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Provisions That Provide That If Any Officer Or Employee Of The State Of Mississippi, Or Any Political Subdivision Thereof, Does Not Pay The State Sales Tax For Which He Is Responsible To Pay Within Two Months After The Sales Tax Becomes Due And Payable, He Is Not Eligible To Receive Any Salary Or Other Emoluments Of Office From The State, Or From Any Political Subdivision Thereof, Until The Sales Tax, Interest And Penalty, Are Paid In Full; To Provide That The Department Of Revenue May Pursue All Remedies For Collection That Are Available To It In The Collection Of Sales Tax Owed By Persons Who Are Not Public Officers Or Employees; To Provide That Any Attachment Or Garnishment Made Against Such Public Officer Or Employee Shall Be For An Amount Of 25% Of The Officer's Or Employee's Disposable Earnings Or The Amount Of The Outstanding Tax Liability, Whichever Is Less; To Amend Sections 7-7-43 And 85-3-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1561.title: MS Affordable Housing Trust Fund; create to assist in the development, rehabilitation and preservation of affordable housing.
1561.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; To Provide That Money In The Trust Fund Shall Be Made Available For Assisting The Development, Rehabilitation And Preservation Of Affordable Housing; To Provide That The Trust Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Create The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund Oversight Board To Approve Rules And Regulations Proposed By The Mississippi Development Authority, To Oversee The Management Of Monies In The Trust Fund And To Approve Awards Of Trust Fund Monies To Applicants; To Provide For The Membership Of The Oversight Board; To Amend Section 75-76-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of All Taxes, Fees, Interest, Penalties, Damages, Fines Or Other Monies Collected By The Department Of Revenue Under The Gaming Control Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Mississippi Affordable Housing Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1562.title: Mississippi Emergency Management Agency; require to state's share of matching funds regarding tornado damage to certain county owned hospital.
1562.description: An Act Provide That The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency Shall Pay The State's Share Of Matching Funds Required By The Federal Emergency Management Agency In Connection With Tornado Damage To A County Owned Hospital That Is Operated By An Entity Exempt From Federal Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code And Which Damage Was A Result Of The Tornado That Damaged The Hospital In April Of 2014; To Bring Forward Sections 33-15-305, 33-15-307, 33-15-311, 33-15-313 And 33-15-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Disaster Assistance Act Of 1993, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1563.title: Capitol Complex Improvement District; create and fund improvement projects within.
1563.description: An Act To Create The Capitol Complex Improvement District; To Establish The Board Of Directors Of The Capitol Complex Improvement District To Implement And Supervise Certain Improvement Projects Within Such District; To Authorize The Board Of Directors To Employ An Executive Director Who Shall Be The Chief Executive Officer Of The Board And Administer The Day-to-day Activities Of The District; To Authorize The Executive Director, Subject To Approval Of The Board Of Directors, To Employ Persons As He Or She Considers Necessary For The Proper Conduct Of Board Business; To Create The Capitol Complex Improvement District Project Advisory Committee; To Provide That The Board Of Directors Shall Develop A Comprehensive Plan For Improvement Projects In The District In Consultation With The Capitol Complex Improvement District Project Advisory Committee; To Provide That Such Plan Shall Attempt To Incorporate The Needs Of The City Of Jackson, The Department Of Finance And Administration, Jackson State University, The University Of Mississippi Medical Center And The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History; To Provide That Any Plan Adopted By The Board Of Directors Must Be Approved By The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson; To Require Improvement Projects Undertaken Under This Act To Comport With The Plan; To Provide That The Plan May Be Updated At Any Time And Shall Be Completely Updated Every Five Years; To Create The Capitol Complex Improvement District Project Fund, Into Which Shall Be Deposited The Money Specified In Section 27-65-75 And Such Other Money As The Legislature May Provide By Appropriation; To Provide That An Amount Not To Exceed Five Percent Of The Amount Deposited Into The Fund May Be Utilized To Fund The Administrative Expenses Of The District; To Provide That An Amount Of Not Less Than 95% Of The Amount Deposited Into The Fund Shall Be Utilized Within The District For Improvement Projects; To Provide That The City Of Jackson Shall Provide Police Coverage For Major Events Conducted Within The District And Shall Maintain All Infrastructure And Completed Improvement Projects Within The District; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Divert 12-1/2% Of The Total Sales Tax Revenue Collected On Business Activities Within The City Of Jackson And To Distribute 15% Of The Revenue So Collected To The City Of Jackson To Compensate The City For General Police And Fire Protection Provided By The City In The Capitol Complex Improvement District And For Police Coverage For Major Events Conducted Within Such District, And To Provide That The Remainder Of Such Revenue So Collected Shall Be Deposited Into The Capitol Complex Improvement District Project Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1565.title: Income tax; authorize a deduction for certain retrofitting or upgrades to homes in Coastal Area of Mississippi.
1565.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Deduction For Certain Retrofitting Or Upgrades To Homes Located In The Coastal Area Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1566.title: Income tax; authorize counties and municipalities to collect certain debts by setoff against the debtor's income tax refund.
1566.description: An Act To Enact The "local Government Debt Collection Setoff Act"; To Authorize Counties And Municipalities To Submit Certain Debts Owed To Them To The Department Of Revenue For Collection Through A Setoff Against The Debtors' Mississippi Income Tax Refund; To Provide That The Counties And Municipalities Shall Utilize The Mississippi Association Of Supervisors Or The Mississippi Municipal League, As Appropriate, As Their Agents In Utilizing This Procedure; To Provide The Amount Of The Debt And Income Tax Refunds To Which This Act Applies; To Provide For The Duties Of The Department Of Revenue Under This Act; To Authorize The Exchange Of Information Between The Department Of Revenue, Local Government And Their Member Organizations That Is Necessary To Accomplish And Effectuate The Intent Of This Act; To Provide That Information Obtained From The Department Of Revenue Shall Retain Its Confidentiality And To Provide Penalties For The Unlawful Disclosure Of Such Information; To Amend Section 27-7-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1567.title: Tax increment financing; clarify what constitutes cost of a redevelopment project under.
1567.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-45-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Cost Of A Redevelopment Project Under The Tax Increment Financing Act Includes The Cost Associated With The Operation And Maintenance Of Certain Property Rights To Real Property That May Have Been Purchased By A Municipality For The Project, As May Be Authorized In The Applicable Redevelopment Plan; To Amend Sections 21-45-11 And 21-45-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1568.title: Mobile homes; give owner of one year to redeem the property after sold for taxes.
1568.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-41-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Owner Of A Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home That Was Sold For Taxes Or Any Person Interested In The Property To Redeem The Property At Any Time Within One Year After The Day Of The Sale By Paying To The Chancery Clerk The Amount Of All Taxes For Which The Property Was Sold, With Costs Incident To The Sale, Damages On The Amount Of Taxes And Interest From The Date Of The Sale; To Provide That The Chancery Clerk Shall Provide Notice To The Owner Of The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home, And To Any Lienholders On The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home, Within Ninety Days And Not Less Than Forty-five Days Before The Expiration Of The Time Of Redemption With Respect To The Property Sold For Taxes, Which Notice Shall Be In The Same Form And Manner As The Notice Given To Owners And Lienholders Of Land Sold For Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

1569.title: Ad valorem tax; provide manner in which appraisal of ground leases on property leased by MS State Port at Gulfport is conducted.
1569.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-35-50, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Manner In Which The Appraisal Of Ground Leases On Property Leased By The Mississippi State Port At Gulfport Shall Be Made For The Purpose Of Arriving At The True Value Of The Property For Ad Valorem Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1570.title: Manufactured and mobile homes; require certain notice to tax collector when relocated from another county.
1570.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-53-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Is Relocated From One County To Another County, Then The Owner Of The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Shall Provide Notice To The Tax Collector Of The County From Which The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Was Relocated; To Bring Forward Section 27-53-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Penalty For Violations Of The Laws Providing For The Registration And Assessment Of Manufactured Homes And Mobile Homes For Ad Valorem Tax Purposes, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1571.title: Local government capital improvements revolving loan program; include municipal natural gas facilities.
1571.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "capital Improvements" For Purposes Of The Local Governments Capital Improvements Revolving Loan Program To Include Repair, Renovation And Improvement Of Municipal Natural Gas Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1572.title: Sales tax; provide additional diversion to Jackson to defray ad valorem tax loss and increased costs incurred as seat of state government.
1572.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Payment Of An Additional Percentage Of Sales Tax Revenue Generated From Business Activities Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To The City Of Jackson; To Provide That Such Payment To The City Of Jackson Is For The Purpose Of Assisting The City To Defray The Ad Valorem Tax Loss The City Sustains As A Result Of The State Ownership Of Property In The City, And For Defraying Increased Infrastructure And Public Safety Costs Incurred By The City As A Result Of Being The Seat Of State Government; To Provide That Monies Paid To The City Of Jackson Under This Act Shall Be Expended Solely For Road And Other Infrastructure Projects And Police And Fire Protection Services; And For Related Purposes.

1573.title: Fuel taxes; allocate a portion to the City of Jackson to defray costs incurred as a result of being the seat of state government.
1573.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From The Proceeds Of Gasoline, Diesel Fuel Or Kerosene Taxes, An Amount Equal To 1% Of The Revenue From Gasoline And Diesel Fuel Taxes On Gasoline, Diesel Fuel And Kerosene Sold Within The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, Shall Be Allocated For Distribution To The City Of Jackson And Paid To The City; To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1574.title: Income and sales tax; job tax credit for supermarkets in economically distressed communities, sales tax exemption for materials.
1574.description: An Act To Authorize A Job Tax Credit For Supermarkets Located In Economically Distressed Communities In An Amount Equal To 10% Of The Payroll Of The Supermarket; To Provide That The Amount Of The Credit Taken In Any One Tax Year Shall Be Limited To An Amount Not Greater Than 50% Of The Taxpayer's State Income Tax Liability Attributable To Income Derived From Operations In The State For That Year; To Provide That The Aggregate Amount Of Tax Credits That May Be Awarded Under This Act In Any One Calendar Year Shall Not Exceed $4,000,000.00; To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Materials Used In The Construction Of A Supermarket That Is Located In An Area Designated As An Economically Distressed Community Pursuant To This Act, Or Any Addition Or Improvement Thereon, And Sales Of Any Machinery And Equipment Not Later Than Three Months After The Completion Of Construction Of The Building, Or Any Addition Or Improvement Thereon, To Be Used In The Supermarket; And For Related Purposes.

1575.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for taxpayers who serve as volunteer firefighters.
1575.description: An Act To Authorize A Refundable Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Serve As Volunteer Firefighters; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Provide That If The Amount Of Tax Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; And For Related Purposes.

1576.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of water and sawdust when used for agricultural purposes.
1576.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Potable Water To A Producer For Use Directly In The Production Of Poultry Or Poultry Products, The Production Of Livestock And Livestock Products, The Production Of Domesticated Fish And Domesticated Fish Products, The Production Of Marine Aquaculture Products, The Production Of Plants Or Food By Commercial Horticulturists, The Processing Of Milk And Milk Products, The Processing Of Poultry And Livestock Feed And The Irrigation Of Farm Crops; To Amend Section 27-65-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Sawdust To A Producer For Use Directly In The Production Of Poultry Or Poultry Products, The Production Of Livestock And Livestock Products, The Production Of Domesticated Fish And Domesticated Fish Products, The Production Of Marine Aquaculture Products, The Production Of Plants Or Food By Commercial Horticulturists, The Processing Of Milk And Milk Products, The Processing Of Poultry And Livestock Feed And The Irrigation Of Farm Crops; And For Related Purposes.

1577.title: Public contracts; give preference to certain veteran-owned small businesses.
1577.description: An Act To Provide That The Department Of Finance And Administration, In Consultation With The State Veterans Affairs Board And The Mississippi Development Authority, May Determine Goals Regarding Service-connected Disabled Veteran-owned Small Business Participation In State Contracts And Procurements; To Provide That In The Letting Of Public Contracts, Whenever All Things Stated In The Bids Are Substantially Equal With Regard To Quality And Service But Differ Only With Respect To Price, Preference May Be Given To Certified Service-connected Disabled Veteran-owned Small Businesses If The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From A Certified Service-connected Disabled Veteran-owned Small Business Is Not More Than 10% Greater Than The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Other Bidders; And For Related Purposes.

1579.title: City of Florence; extend repealer on bar and restaurant tax.
1579.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 939, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Amended By Chapter 1046, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Chapter 921, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Extend The Repeal Date From December 31, 2016, To December 31, 2020, On The Law That Authorizes The City Of Florence To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of The Sales Of Bars And Restaurants; And For Related Purposes.

1580.title: City of Fulton; extend repealer on hotel/motel tourism tax.
1580.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 939, Local And Private Laws Of 2010, As Amended By Chapter 932, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2016, To July 1, 2020, On The Law That Authorizes The City Of Fulton, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals For Hotels Or Motels Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

1581.title: Harrison County; revise definition of blighted property.
1581.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 939, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, To Revise The Definition Of Blighted Property For Purposes Of Granting The Board Of Supervisors Of Harrison County, Mississippi, The Authority To Clean Blighted Property; And For Related Purposes.

1582.title: City of Natchez/Adams County; authorize to contributions to Natchez, Inc.
1582.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Natchez, Inc., A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation Organized For Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1583.title: Oktibbeha County; authorize contribution to Brickfire Project - Day Care Center.
1583.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Oktibbeha County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Brickfire

1584.title: Grenada County; authorize to contract with the United States and other states to house minimum or medium security offenders in.
1584.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 999, Local And Private Laws Of 1997, As Amended By Chapter 944, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Authorize The Grenada County Board Of Supervisors To Contract With The United States And Any State Or States For The Housing Of Minimum Or Medium Security Offenders Who Are In The Custody Of Those Jurisdictions; And For Related Purposes.

1585.title: City of Natchez/Adams County; authorize contributions to Natchez, Inc.
1585.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Natchez, Inc., A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation Organized For Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1586.title: City of Batesville; extend repealer on tourism and industry promotion tax.
1586.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 824, Local And Private Laws Of 1992, As Amended By Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 1997, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2017, To July 1, 2023, On The Provisions Of Law That Levy The Tourism And Industry Promotion Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals And Restaurant Sales In The City And Create The City Of Batesville, Mississippi, And South Panola Area Chamber Of Commerce Tourism And Industrial Development Committee; To Provide For An Indirect Referendum On The Continuation Of The Levying Of Such Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1587.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize annual contribution to Pigs-In-Flight museum.
1587.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To Pigs-in-flight, A Children's Museum That Provides Early Childhood Education Programs; And For Related Purposes.

1588.title: City of Jackson; authorize to continue contributions to keep Jackson Beautiful, Inc.
1588.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 966, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Amended By Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 902, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 908, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Continue To Pay Keep Jackson Beautiful, Inc., For Its Services In Regard To A Litter Prevention Program Through Calendar Year 2020; And For Related Purposes.

1589.title: City of Ripley; authorize expansion of gas distribution system more than 5 miles outside corporate limits of.
1589.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ripley, Mississippi, To Expand Its Gas Distribution System Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Ripley; And For Related Purposes.

1590.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize to contribute funds and in-kind services to Tate Cemetery.
1590.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To And/or Provide In-kind Services For The Maintenance Of Tate Cemetery; And For Related Purposes.

1591.title: Oktibbeha County; authorize contribution to a certain scholarship fund.
1591.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Oktibbeha County, Mississippi, To Make Contributions To The Devin R. Mitchell Scholarship Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1592.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to certain organizations.
1592.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc., Mississippi Food Network, Triumph Ministries, Inc., Vicksburg Family Development Service, Warren, Washington, Issaquena, Sharkey Community Action Agency, We Care Services, Inc., And Women's Restoration Shelter; And For Related Purposes.

1593.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist the Scott Ford House, Inc., in developing two historic properties in Jackson.
1593.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Scott Ford House, Inc., In Paying Costs Associated With Developing Two Historic Properties On East Cohea Street In The City Of Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1594.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Jackson with making road and street improvements near Jackson State University.
1594.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To Roads And Streets In Close Proximity To The Campus Of Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

1595.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for the Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund.
1595.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,000,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1596.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist with construction of Partnership School at Mississippi State University.
1596.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of The Partnership School On The Campus Of Mississippi State University; And For Related Purposes.

1597.title: Mississippi Main Street Investment Act; create.
1597.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Main Street Investment Act; To Provide Definitions For This Act; To Create The Mississippi Main Street Investment Loan Fund; To Require The Mississippi Development Authority To Establish A Program To Make Loans To Municipalities To Assist With Maintaining And Improving The Viability Of Revitalization Zones; To Require A Municipality Desiring A Loan Under This Act To Submit An Application To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Review The Application Of A Municipality In Order To Confirm That The Revitalization Zone Meets The Requirements Of This Act; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Establish A Deadline For The Submission Of Applications During A State Fiscal Year; To Provide That If A Municipality In Which A Revitalization Zone Is Located Receives A Loan Under This Section, Then The Sales Tax Revenue Collected Within A Revitalization Zone Shall Be Allocated For Distribution To The Municipality In Which The Revitalization Zone Is Located And Paid To The Municipality; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority With All Powers Necessary To Implement And Administer The Program Authorized By This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $5,000,000.00 And Provide That The Proceeds Of Such Bonds Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Main Street Investment Loan Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1598.title: Perry County; authorize contribution to Community Development, Inc.
1598.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Perry County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To Community Development, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1599.title: Greene County; extend repeal date on assessments in justice court.
1599.description: An Act To Amend Section 1, Chapter 940, Local And Private Laws Of 2009, As Amended By Chapter 917, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2016, To July 1, 2020, On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Greene County, Mississippi, To Assess A Certain Fee For Any Civil Case Filed And Any Misdemeanor Conviction Obtained In The Justice Court Of The County To Fund Certain Maintenance And Construction Needs Of The Greene County Justice Court Complex; And For Related Purposes.

1600.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize contribution to Pigs-in-Flight Museum.
1600.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To Pigs-in-flight, A Children's Museum That Provides Early Childhood Education Programs; And For Related Purposes.

1602.title: City of Quitman; authorize levying of an additional sales tax for certain purposes.
1602.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Quitman, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Tax Not To Exceed 1% Of The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Or Gross Income Businesses In The City From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Or More Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide For An Election On The Question Of Imposing The Special Sales Tax; To Authorize The City To Incur Indebtedness In An Amount Not Greater Than An Amount Whose Debt Service Is Capable Of Being Funded By The Revenue From The Special Sales Tax; To Provide That Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax Must Be Expended By The City Only To Fund Infrastructure Projects And Economic Development Projects; And For Related Purposes.

1603.title: City of Petal; authorize placement of certain specialty street signs within.
1603.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Petal, Mississippi, To Display The Placement Of Certain Specialty Street Signs Along Certain Highways Within The Corporate Limits Of The City; And For Related Purposes.

1604.title: Adams County; authorize to settle claims for obligations of former Natchez Regional Medical Center for unfunded employer retirement plan contributions.
1604.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County, Mississippi, To Purchase The Claim Of The Public Employees' Retirement System (pers) That Was Made In Bankruptcy Proceedings For Obligations Of The Natchez Regional Medical Center (hospital) For Unpaid Employer Contributions For Employees Of The Hospital Covered By Pers In Order To Enable Pers To Calculate And Pay The Full Amounts Owed In Retirement Benefits To Such Employees; To Authorize And Direct Pers To Sell And Assign To Adams County, Mississippi, All Of Its Claim Against The Hospital For Unpaid Employer Contributions Upon Payment Of The Claim; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County, Mississippi, To Borrow Money And Issue Its Notes, Certificates Of Indebtedness Or Bonds For A Term Not To Exceed 10 Years For The Purpose Of Funding The Costs And Expenses Of Purchasing The Claim Of Pers As Authorized By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1605.title: Jackson County; authorize to clean blighted property and assess cost of such as lien against property owner.
1605.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Conduct Hearings To Determine Whether Certain Property Within The County Is Blighted Property; To Require The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Notice To The Owners Of "blighted" Property; To Provide The Form And Manner Of The Notice; To Authorize The County To Charge The Actual Costs Of Correcting The Blighted Property; To Authorize The County To Assess Penalties Against The Property; And For Related Purposes.

1606.title: Coahoma County; authorize contribution to the Family and Youth Opportunities Division.
1606.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To Family And Youth Opportunities Division, A Nonprofit Corporation, In An Amount To Be Determined By The Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

1607.title: Harrison County; authorize creation of Civil Service Commission for sheriff's department.
1607.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Harrison County, Mississippi, To Create The Civil Service Commission For The Harrison County Sheriff's Department; To Provide The Policies And Procedures Of Such Commission; To Provide For The Membership Of Such Commission; To Provide The Time That Such Commission Shall Meet; To Provide The Duties Of Such Commission And Their Compensation; To Provide That Any Employee Subject To Personnel Action May Have A Hearing; To Require Such Commission To Maintain A Roster Of All Personnel Employed By Such Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1608.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of McComb in making improvements to Parklane Road.
1608.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To A Portion Of Parklane Road Located In The City Of Mccomb, And For Related Water And Sewer Infrastructure Improvements; And For Related Purposes.

1609.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for state acquisition of the former Wright and Ferguson Funeral Home property in Jackson.
1609.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Acquisition Of The Former Wright And Ferguson Funeral Home Property In The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, As Authorized By Senate Bill No. 2685, 2015 Regular Session; And For Related Purposes.

1610.title: Mississippi Site Development Grant Program; create and authorize issuance of bonds to provide funds for.
1610.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Site Development Grant Program To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Providing Grants To Municipalities, Counties And Local Economic Development Organizations To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Improving The Marketability Of Publicly Owned Industrial Property For Industrial Economic Development Purposes; To Create The Mississippi Site Development Grant Fund To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Site Development Grant Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1611.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to school districts for vocational education improvements.
1611.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The State Department Of Education To Make Funding Available To School Districts For The Purpose Of Enhancing Vocational Education Programs In The Public School System; To Establish A Program In The State Department Of Education To Make Funding Available To School Districts For The Purpose Of Enhancing Vocational Education Programs In The Public School System; To Specify Certain Information That Must Be Included In A School District's Application For An Allocation Of Funds Under The Program; To Require The State Board Of Education To Adopt Rules And Regulations Governing The Application Process; To Provide That The Establishment Of Such Program Shall Be Subject To Legislative Appropriation; And For Related Purposes.

1612.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds for various Mississippi Development Authority programs.
1612.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $1,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Development Authority Workforce Training Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $2,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through A Development Infrastructure Grant Fund To Complete Infrastructure Related To New Or Expanded Industry; To Increase The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Grants Or Loans To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Facilities; To Amend Section 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 1, 2016 First Extraordinary Session, To Increase From $63,000,000.00 To $64,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act For Projects Designed To Enhance Facilities That Are At Risk For Closure Pursuant To The Base Closure And Realignment Act Of 1991 Or Other Applicable Federal Law; To Amend Section 65-4-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $1,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Economic Development Highway Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Pascagoula Redevelopment Authority For Use By The Authority In Its Commercial Development Incentive Program To Incentivize Private Investment Into Mixed Use And Commercial Projects Along The Waterfront Of The Pascagoula River; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Oakland-yalobusha Natural Gas District In Paying Costs Associated With Improvements To District Infrastructure, Equipment And Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1613.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Natchez with the construction of a river landing dock along riverfront.
1613.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Natchez, Mississippi,

1614.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds for extension of Tyner Road in City of Petal.
1614.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Petal, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Extending Tyner Road To The Evelyn Gandy Parkway And Related Water And Sewer Infrastructure Improvements; And For Related Purposes.

1615.title: Appropriation; Barber Examiners, Board of.
1615.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Barber Examiners For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1616.title: Appropriation; Nursing, Board of.
1616.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Board Of Nursing For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1617.title: Appropriation; Nursing Home Administrators, Board of.
1617.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Nursing Home Administrators For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1618.title: Appropriation: Real Estate Commission and Appraiser Licensing and Certification Board.
1618.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Real Estate Commission And Mississippi Real Estate Appraiser Licensing And Certification Board For Fiscal Year 2017.

1619.title: Appropriation; Athletic Commission.
1619.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Athletic Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1620.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Medical Licensure For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1621.title: Appropriation; Auctioneers Commission.
1621.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Auctioneers Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1622.title: Appropriation; Psychology, Board of.
1622.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Psychology For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1623.title: Appropriation; Cosmetology, Board of.
1623.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Cosmetology For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1624.title: Appropriation; Physical Therapy Board.
1624.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Physical Therapy For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1625.title: Appropriation; Optometry, Board of.
1625.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Optometry For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1626.title: Appropriation; Engineers and Land Surveyors, Board of Registration for Professional.
1626.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Registration For Professional Engineers And Land Surveyors For Fiscal Year 2017.

1627.title: Appropriation; Social Workers and Marriage and Family Therapists, Board of Examiners for.
1627.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Board Of Examiners For Social Workers And Marriage And Family Therapists For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1628.title: Appropriation; Coast Coliseum Commission.
1628.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Coast Coliseum Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1629.title: Appropriation; Public Employees' Retirement System.
1629.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Administrative Expenses Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Public Employees' Retirement System And For The Maintenance And Operation Of The Retirement System Building For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1630.title: Appropriation; Oil and Gas Board.
1630.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From General Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Oil And Gas Board For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1631.title: Appropriation; Veterans' Home Purchase Board.
1631.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Veterans' Home Purchase Board And Making New Home Loans As Authorized By Law For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1632.title: Appropriation; Attorney General.
1632.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of The Attorney General For Fiscal Year 2017.

1633.title: Appropriation; District attorneys and staff.
1633.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Paying Salaries And Travel Expenses Of District Attorneys And Assistant District Attorneys Of The State And Paying Office Expenses Of District Attorneys For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1634.title: Appropriation; Supreme Court, Court of Appeals and trial judges services.
1634.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Supreme Court Which Is Comprised Of The Supreme Court, The Office Of The Supreme Court Clerk And The State Law Library And To Pay Expenses Of Special Judges, Chancellors And Circuit Judges, And For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Administrative Office Of Courts And Certified Court Reporters, Continuing Legal Education, Court Of Appeals And The Board Of Bar Admissions, For The Fiscal Year 2017; And For Related Purposes.

1635.title: Appropriation; Legislative expenses.
1635.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Paying The Expenses And Providing Contingent Funds For The Legislature, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Budget Committee, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review, The Expenses Of The Joint Legislative Reapportionment Committee, The Expenses Of The Joint Committee On Compilation, Revision And Publication Of Legislation, Paying The Monthly Expense Allowance Of The Members Of The Legislature, Paying The State's Share Of Various Assessments, And Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1636.title: Appropriation; Capital Post-Conviction Counsel, Office of.
1636.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of Capital Post-conviction Counsel Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1637.title: Appropriation; State Public Defender, Office of.
1637.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office Of State Public Defender Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1638.title: Appropriation; Insurance, Department of.
1638.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From General Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Insurance For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1639.title: Appropriation; Fire Academy.
1639.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From General Fund In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Fire Academy For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1640.title: Appropriation; Public Service Commission.
1640.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From General Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Public Service Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1641.title: Appropriation; Public Utilities Staff.
1641.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From General Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Public Utilities Staff For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1642.title: Appropriation; Education, Department of.
1642.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Funding K-12 And Other Related Educational Activities, Including Certain Agencies And Programs, In The State Of Mississippi, For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1643.title: Appropriation; Educational Television, Authority for.
1643.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Authority For Educational Television For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1644.title: Appropriation; Library Commission.
1644.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Library Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1645.title: Appropriation; Arts Commission.
1645.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Arts Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1646.title: Appropriation; Archives and History, Department of.
1646.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Department Of Archives And History, For The Fiscal Year 2017; And For Related Purposes.

1647.title: Appropriation; Transportation, Department of.
1647.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, For The Fiscal Year 2017; And For Related Purposes.

1648.title: Appropriation; Mississippi River Parkway Commission.
1648.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi River Parkway Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1649.title: Appropriation; Medicaid, Division of.
1649.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Governor's Office-division Of Medicaid For The Purpose Of Providing Medical Assistance Under The Mississippi Medicaid Law And Defraying The Expenses Of The Administration Of That Law For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1650.title: Appropriation; Health, Department of.
1650.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Health For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1651.title: Appropriation; Human Services, Department of.
1651.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Human Services; And For Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1652.title: Appropriation; Rehabilitation Services, Department of.
1652.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Rehabilitation Services For Fiscal Year 2017.

1653.title: Appropriation; Forestry Commission.
1653.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The State Forestry Commission And For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Institute For Forest Inventory For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1654.title: Appropriation; Soil and Water Conservation Commission.
1654.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Soil And Water Conservation Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1655.title: Appropriation; Foresters, Board of Registration for.
1655.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Board Of Registration For Foresters For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1656.title: Appropriation; Marine Resources, Department of.
1656.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Marine Resources For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1657.title: Appropriation; Tombigbee River Valley Water Management District.
1657.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Tombigbee River Valley Water Management District For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1658.title: Appropriation; Pearl River Valley Water Supply District.
1658.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1659.title: Appropriation; Pearl River Basin Development District.
1659.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of General Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pearl River Basin Development District For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1660.title: Appropriation; Pat Harrison Waterway District.
1660.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Pat Harrison Waterway District For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1661.title: Appropriation; Port Authority, State.
1661.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Port Authority At Gulfport For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1662.title: Appropriation; Yellow Creek State Inland Port Authority.
1662.description: An Act Approving The Expenditure Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Yellow Creek State Inland Port Authority For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1663.title: Appropriation; Environmental Quality, Department of.
1663.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Environmental Quality; And For Related Purposes, For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1664.title: Appropriation; Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks, Department of.
1664.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1665.title: Appropriation; Grand Gulf Military Monument Commission.
1665.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Grand Gulf Military Monument Commission For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1666.title: Appropriation; reappropriation, DFA - Bureau of Building; FY15.
1666.description: An Act Making A Reappropriation To The Department Of Finance And Administration To Reauthorize The Expenditure Of Special Funds Previously Appropriated For Construction And/or Repair And Renovation Projects At Various State Agencies And Institutions, For Fiscal Year 2017.

1667.title: Appropriation; community colleges for additional funds toward reaching mid-level funding.
1667.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Aid And Support Of The Public Community And Junior Colleges Of The State Of Mississippi For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funds Toward Reaching Mid-level Funding For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1669.title: Corporation franchise tax; repeal.
1669.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Tax Years Beginning On Or After January 1, 2017, There Shall Be No Corporation Franchise Tax Levied On The Value Of Capital Used, Invested Or Employed By A Corporation In This State; To Repeal, Effective January 1, 2018, Sections 27-13-1 Through 27-13-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Corporation Franchise Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

1670.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for costs incurred by taxpayer for participation in Mississippi Emergency Access Program.
1670.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Incur Costs For Participation In The Mississippi Emergency Access Program; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1671.title: Professional privilege tax; impose on attorneys who practice in state, are not domiciled in and do not maintain regular place of business in state.
1671.description: An Act To Impose A Privilege Tax On Attorneys Who Practice In This State And Are Not Domiciled In This State And Do Not Maintain A Regular Place Of Business In This State; To Provide A Fine For Failure To Pay The Tax; To Provide That The Revenue Derived From The Privilege Tax Provided For In This Act Shall Be Deposited Into The Civil Legal Assistance Fund; To Bring Forward Section 27-15-251, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Penalties For Violations Of The State-wide Privilege Tax Law, For The Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1672.title: Sales tax; exempt certain sales of tangible personal property to volunteer fire departments for use solely in department purposes.
1672.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property To Volunteer Fire Departments For Use Solely In Department Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1673.title: Ad valorem tax; revise provisions regarding fee-in-lieu of ad valorem taxes.
1673.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 1, 2016 First Extraordinary Session, To Provide That County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Authorities May Enter Into Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes Agreements For Projects Totaling Over $20,000,000.00; To Provide That A Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes Agreement May Extend For Up To Thirty Years From The Commencement Of The Fee-in-lieu Period Granted Therein, However, No Particular Parcel Of Land, Real Property Improvement Or Item Of Personal Property Shall Be Subject To A Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes For A Duration Of More Than Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

1674.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for certain small businesses that create new jobs.
1674.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Small Business Enterprises That Create New Full-time Jobs; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That A Small Business Enterprise Must Increase Employment By At Least 10 Percent In Order To Be Eligible For The Tax Credit; To Provide That A Tax Credit Claimed Under This Act But Not Used In A Taxable Year May Be Carried Forward For Five Years From The Close Of The Tax Year In Which The Qualified Jobs Were Created; And For Related Purposes.

1675.title: Income tax; revise provisions regarding net income of nonresidents, revise definition of term "doing business."
1675.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Net Income Of Nonresidents Derived From Property, Activity And Other Sources Within Mississippi Is Subject To The State Income Tax; To Amend Section 27-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "doing Business" For Purposes Of The State Income Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

1676.title: Sales tax; continue to exempt sales of agricultural products grown in this state and cut and first sold from place of production.
1676.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Agricultural Sales Tax Exemption For Sales Of Christmas Trees, Hay, Straw, Fresh Cut Flowers And Similar Products When The Products Are Grown In This State And Cut, Severed Or Otherwise Removed From The Place Of Production And First Sold From Such Place Of Production In The Original State Or Condition Of Preparation For Sale; And For Related Purposes.

1677.title: Income tax; allow a credit to grocers for part of cost of purchasing locally grown or produced agricultural products.
1677.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-7-22.39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A State Income Tax Credit To Grocers For A Percentage Of The Cost Of Purchasing Locally Grown Or Produced Agricultural, Aquacultural Or Horticultural Products For Sale At Retail For Human Consumption; And For Related Purposes.

1678.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for certain contributions to support the MS Integrated Basic Education and Skills Training Program.
1678.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Contributions To Certain Nonprofit Organizations That Are Made To Support The Mississippi Integrated Basic Education And Skills Training Model Program; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit That May Be Claimed In Any Taxable Year; To Limit The Aggregate Amount Of Credits That May Be Awarded Under This Act In Any One Calendar Year; And For Related Purposes.

1679.title: Sales tax; increase rate and deposit additional revenue into the Education Enhancement Fund.
1679.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-65-17, 27-65-75 And 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The State Sales Tax; To Provide That The Revenue Derived From The Additional Tax Levied Under This Act Shall Be Deposited Into The Education Enhancement Fund; To Exempt From The Additional Tax Levied Under This Act Retail Sales Of Food For Human Consumption Not Purchased With Food Stamps But Which Would Be Exempt From Sales Tax If Such Food Were Purchased With Food Stamps; And For Related Purposes.

1680.title: Excise tax on gasoline and diesel; revise rate.
1680.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of The Gasoline Excise Tax; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-12, 27-55-19 And 27-55-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Certain Exemptions And Refunds Under The Gasoline Excise Tax Law, For The Purposes Of Amendment; To Amend Section 27-55-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of The Special Fuel Excise Tax Imposed On Undyed Diesel Fuel; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-521, 27-55-523 And 27-55-533, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Mississippi Special Fuel Tax Law, For Purposes Of Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Distribution Of Fuel Taxes, For The Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1681.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements at University of Mississippi Medical Center.
1681.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Establishing A Clinical Research Unit At The University Of Mississippi Medical Center And Expansion Of Blair E. Batson Children's Hospital; And For Related Purposes.

1682.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for capital improvements at the Mississippi State Fire Academy.
1682.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The Mississippi State Fire Academy; And For Related Purposes.

1683.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements to Mississippi National Guard Armories.
1683.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To Mississippi National Guard Armories In The State; And For Related Purposes.

1684.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Hattiesburg with improvements to water system infrastructure.
1684.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Upgrades Of And Improvements To Water Lines And Related Water Systems Infrastructure Within The Boundaries Of The Areas Formerly Known As And Served By The Central Utility Association And The Palmers Crossing Utility Association; And For Related Purposes.

1685.title: Mississippi Small Business Investment Company Act; increase the amount of investment tax credits that may be allocated under.
1685.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-115-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $100,000,000.00 The Aggregate Amount Of Investment Tax Credits That May Be Allocated To Participating Investors Of Mississippi Small Business Investment Companies Under The Mississippi Small Business Investment Company Act; To Provide The Taxable Years In Which A Participating Investor May Claim The Additional Credits So Allocated Against His Premium Tax Liability; And For Related Purposes.

1686.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property or services to subsidiary or affiliate of the MS Children's Museum operating satellite museum in this state.
1686.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Sales Tax Exemption For Durable Medical Equipment And Home Medical Supplies Shall Include The Same Type Of Equipment Listed Under The Medicare And Medicaid Programs And Certain Other Equipment And To Clarify From Whom Payments For Home Medical Equipment And Home Medical Supplies May Be Made In Order For The Sale To Be Exempt From Sales Taxation; To Change The Date Of The Sales Tax Exemption For Retail Sales Of Firearms, Ammunition And Hunting Supplies From The First Weekend In September To The Last Weekend In August; To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property Or Services To Any Subsidiary Or Affiliate Of The Mississippi Children's Museum Operating A Satellite Or Branch Museum In This State; And For Related Purposes.

1687.title: Town of Walnut Grove; authorize expansion of gas distribution system into certain areas of Leake and Scott Counties.
1687.description: An Act To Authorize The Town Of Walnut Grove, Mississippi, To Expand Its Gas Distribution System Into Certain Areas In Leake And Scott Counties, Mississippi, And For Related Purposes.

1689.title: Sunflower County; authorize contribution to Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation.
1689.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Sunflower County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

1690.title: Historic property income tax credit; increase maximum amount of credits and extend time for taxpayer eligibility.
1690.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes An Income Tax Credit For Costs And Expenses Incurred For The Rehabilitation Of Certain Historic Structures, To Increase The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of Tax Credits That May Be Awarded; To Provide That The Tax Credit Shall Apply To Taxpayers Who Have Been Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit Before December 31, 2031, Or Who, Before December 31, 2031, Have Received A Determination In Writing From The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History That The Rehabilitation Is Consistent With The Historic Character Of The Property And That The Property Meets The United States Secretary Of The Interior's Standards For Rehabilitation And Who Are Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit On Or After December 31, 2031; And For Related Purposes.

1693.title: Excise tax on gasoline and diesel; increase rate.
1693.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Gasoline Excise Tax; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-12, 27-55-19 And 27-55-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Certain Exemptions And Refunds Under The Gasoline Excise Tax Law, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 27-55-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Special Fuel Excise Tax Imposed On Undyed Diesel Fuel; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-521, 27-55-523 And 27-55-533, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Mississippi Special Fuel Tax Law, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1694.title: Taxpayer Pay Raise Act of 2016; phase out income tax on first $5,000.00 of taxable income, phase out franchise tax.
1694.description: An Act To Create The Taxpayer Pay Raise Act Of 2016; To Amend Section 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out, Effective Calendar Year 2021, Income Taxation On The First $5,000.00 Of Taxable Income; To Begin Phasing Out Income Taxation On The Next $5,000.00 Of Taxable Income In Calendar Year 2026 And Complete The Phase-out Income Taxation On Such Amount In Calendar Year 2031; To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Federal Self-employment Taxes Assessed Against Self-employed Individuals Shall Be Allowed As An Adjustment To Gross Income Under The State Income Tax Law; To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The Corporation Franchise Tax Effective January 1, 2026; To Repeal, Effective January 1, 2026, Sections 27-13-1 Through 27-13-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Corporation Franchise Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

1695.title: Income tax; allow credit to venison processors for part of costs of processing venison for MS Hunter's Harvest Program.
1695.description: An Act To Create New Section 27-7-22.39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A State Income Tax Credit To Venison Processers For A Percentage Of The Production Cost Of Processing Venison Donated By Hunters For The Mississippi Hunter's Harvest Program Of The Mississippi Wildlife Federation For Which The Processer Has Not Been Paid Or Otherwise Received Reimbursement; And For Related Purposes.

1696.title: North Tunica County Fire Protection District; authorize increase in mills on real and personal property for support of district.
1696.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Increase By Three Mills The Maximum Amount The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County May Levy Upon Both Real And Personal Property Within The North Tunica Fire Protection District For The Operation, Maintenance And Support Of Such District; To Provide That The Levy Shall Not Be Imposed Upon Certain Utilities; And For Related Purposes.

1697.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for construction of Mississippi Science and Industry Museum in Hattiesburg.
1697.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of The Mississippi Science And Industry Museum In Hattiesburg, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1698.title: Appropriation; Alcorn School District to update and improve the lighting at the Kossuth School baseball field.
1698.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of The Alcorn School District For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To Update And Improve The Lighting At The Kossuth School Baseball Field For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1699.title: Appropriation; Administrative Office of Courts to support pilot programs providing legal representation in TPR cases.
1699.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Administrative Office Of Courts For The Purpose Of Providing Matching Funds To Support The Current Pilot Programs That Provide Legal Representation To Indigent Parents In Termination Of Parental Rights Cases For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1700.title: Appropriation; Hinds County to restore the historical Hinds County Courthouse in Jackson.
1700.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County For The Purpose Of Restoring The Historical Hinds County Courthouse In The City Of Jackson For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1701.title: Appropriations; Hinds County to establish storage and retention repository to house county records.
1701.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County For The Purpose Of Establishing A Climate Controlled Storage And Retention Repository To House Hinds County Record Files For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1702.title: Greene County; authorize to construct county jail anywhere in county.
1702.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Greene County, Mississippi, To Construct A New County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1703.title: Lowndes County; authorize certain payment for removal of storm debris.
1703.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lowndes County, Mississippi, To Expend County Funds For Payment Of Certain Debris Removal; And For Related Purposes.

1704.title: Local privilege taxes; eliminate.
1704.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-17-5, 27-17-9, 27-17-35, 27-17-162, 27-17-230, 27-17-299, 27-17-365, 27-17-415, 27-17-423 And 27-17-425, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Local Privilege Tax Law And Impose Local Privilege Taxes On Various Businesses, To Provide For The July 1, 2017, Repeal Of Such Sections; To Bring Forward Sections 27-17-3, 27-17-451, 27-17-453, 27-17-455, 27-17-457, 27-17-459, 27-17-463, 27-17-465, 27-17-467, 27-17-468, 27-17-469, 27-17-471, 27-17-473, 27-17-475, 27-17-477, 27-17-479, 27-17-483, 27-17-485, 27-17-487, 27-17-489, 27-17-491, 27-17-493, 27-17-495, 27-17-497, 27-17-499, 27-17-501 And 27-17-521, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Local Privilege Tax Law, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Sections 27-27-5 And 27-27-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Imposition Of Annual License Taxes On Slot Amusement Machines Under The Slot Amusement Machine Tax Law, To Provide For The July 1, 2017, Repeal Of Such Sections; To Bring Forward Sections 27-27-3, 27-27-9, 27-27-11, 27-27-12, 27-27-13, 27-27-15, 27-27-17, 27-17-19 And 27-27-21, Which Are Sections Of The Slot Amusement Machine Tax Law, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 27-27-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Imposes A Tax On Vending And Weighing Machines; To Bring Forward Sections 27-27-303 And 27-27-305, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1705.title: Appropriation; Archives and History for Freedom House of Canton Civil Rights Museum.
1705.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Archives And History For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For The Freedom House Of Canton Civil Rights Museum For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1706.title: Corporation franchise tax; phase out effective January 1, 2021.
1706.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 1, 2016 First Extraordinary Session, To Phase Out The Corporation Franchise Tax Effective January 1, 2021; To Repeal, Effective January 1, 2021, Sections 27-13-1 Through 27-13-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Corporation Franchise Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

1707.title: Corporation franchise tax; authorize a credit for costs incurred by taxpayer for participation in Mississippi Emergency Access Program.
1707.description: An Act To Authorize A Corporation Franchise Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Incur Costs For Participation In The Mississippi Emergency Access Program; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

1708.title: Commercial air service; authorize incentive for certain expenditures made to increase service at commercial service airports.
1708.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Credit, Insurance Premium Tax Credit And Gaming Gross Revenue License Fee Credit For Entities That Incur Certain Costs For The Purpose Of Aiding In Increasing Commercial Air Service At Commercial Service Airports In This State; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of The Credits That May Claimed By All Entities In Any One State Fiscal Year Shall Not Exceed $2,500,000.00; To Amend Section 27-15-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Investments That May Reduce A Taxpayer's Insurance Premium Tax Liability Under Such Section Shall Not Include Any Expenditure For Which A Credit May Be Claimed Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1709.title: Appropriation; MDOT for completing portion of County Line Road Project from Tougaloo College to U.S. Hwy 51.
1709.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Purpose Of Completing The Portion Of The County Line Road Project From Tougaloo College To Highway 51 For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1710.title: Appropriations; Hinds County to fund construction of Byram-Clinton Norrell Road Parkway Project.
1710.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To Assist In The Completion Of The Construction Of Segment 1a Of The Byram-clinton Norrell Road Parkway Project For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1711.title: Appropriation; Hinds County to fund centralized wastewater treatment system to service Byram-Clinton Corridor area.
1711.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County For The Purpose Of Providing Funding Of The First Phase Development Of A Centralized Wastewater Treatment System To Service The Byram-clinton Corridor Area For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1712.title: Appropriation; Office of Capital Post-Conviction Counsel for representing all post-capital conviction appeals.
1712.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Office Of Capital Post-conviction Counsel For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Office And Representing All Post-capital Conviction Appeals For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1713.title: Appropriation; Department of Marine Resources for Southern Mississippi Planning and Development District for the Coastal Map Revision Project.
1713.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Marine Resources For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To The Southern Mississippi Planning And Development District For The Coastal Map Revision Project For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1714.title: Appropriation; Hinds County to fund centralized wastewater treatment system to service Byram-Clinton corridor area.
1714.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County For The Purpose Of Providing Funding Of The First Phase Development Of A Centralized Wastewater Treatment System To Service The Byram-clinton Corridor Area For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1716.title: Appropriation; Archives & History for funds to Mississippi Heritage Trust to develop Historic Preservation Toolkit.
1716.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Archives And History For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To The Mississippi Heritage Trust To Research, Develop And Implement A Comprehensive Mississippi Historic Preservation Toolkit And Develop A Model That Will Provide For Collaborative For-profit, Nonprofit And Governmental Incentives For Historic Preservation Development For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1717.title: Appropriation; Hinds County to fund construction of Byram-Clinton Norrell Road Parkway Project.
1717.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Supervisors Of Hinds County For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To Assist In The Completion Of The Construction Of Segment 1a Of The Byram-clinton Norrell Road Parkway Project For The Fiscal Year 2017.

1718.title: Earned income tax credit; authorize an income tax credit in an amount equal to a portion of earned income tax credit.
1718.description: An Act To Authorize An Earned Income Tax Credit In An Amount Equal To A Portion Of The Amount Of The Federal Earned Income Tax Credit Lawfully Claimed By A Taxpayer; And For Related Purposes.

1719.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Pontotoc with establishment of a visitors center.
1719.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Pontotoc, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Improvements To Buildings And Facilities And Real Estate Acquisition For The Purpose Of Establishing A Visitors Center And Related Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1720.title: Livable Homes Tax Credit Act; create.
