3003.title: Alcorn County; authorize contracts with the United States and other states to house medium or minimum security offenders at regional jail.
3003.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Alcorn County, Mississippi, To Contract With The United States And Any State Or States For The Housing Of Minimum Or Medium Security Offenders Who Are In The Custody Of Those Jurisdictions; And For Related Purposes.

3004.title: Sunflower County; authorize contribution to the Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation.
3004.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Sunflower County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

3006.title: Claiborne County; authorize rent of a certain surplus building to Theatre Plus for less than the fair rental value of the building.
3006.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Claiborne County, Mississippi, To Lease A Certain Surplus County-owned Building To Theatre Plus, A Nonprofit Entity, For Less Than The Fair Rental Value Of The Building; To Provide For The Amount That Shall Be Charged For The Lease Of The Building; And For Related Purposes.

3007.title: Marshall County; authorize contributions to charitable nonprofit organizations exempt from federal income taxation.
3007.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute To Charitable Nonprofit Organizations Exempt From Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

3008.title: Lincoln County; authorize contracts for naming rights for the county's park buildings and structures.
3008.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lincoln County, Mississippi, To Contract For Naming Rights For The County's Park Buildings And Structures; And For Related Purposes.

3009.title: City of Houston; revise tax on restaurants, hotels & motels to promote parks & recreation and community economic development.
3009.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 917, Local And Private Laws Of 2015, Which Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Houston, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "hotel" Or "motel"; To Increase The Amount Of The Tax That May Be Levied; To Extend Until December 31, 2020, The Repeal Date On This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3010.title: City of Jackson; authorize to create special local improvement taxing districts.
3010.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By The Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

3011.title: City of Booneville; authorize a tax on restaurants to promote tourism and parks & recreation.
3011.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of Booneville To Levy A Tax Upon The Sales Of Prepared Foods And Beverages At Restaurants And To Utilize The Proceeds Of The Tax To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

3012.title: Town of Marion; authorize the expansion of the town's water and sewer system for a distance of not more than 15 miles outside the town.
3012.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Marion In Lauderdale County, Mississippi, To Expand Its Water And Sewer System Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The Town Of Marion; And For Related Purposes.

3013.title: Lee County; authorize a youth court referee to assist the county court.
3013.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lee County, Mississippi To Establish The Position Of Lee County Youth Court Referee; To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of Certain Municipalities In Lee County To Supplement The Salaries Of The Lee County Youth Court Referee And Staff Of The Lee County Youth Court Or The Lee County Juvenile Detention Center; To Provide That The Lee County Judge Shall Appoint The Youth Court Referee And That The Board Of Supervisors Of The County Shall Set The Salary Of The Youth Court Referee; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Create A Staff Position To Aid The Youth Court; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Execute Any Contracts, Interlocal Agreements Or Other Instruments, And Take Any Other Action Necessary Or Convenient To Carry Out The Purposes Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3015.title: Adopt permanent rules of the Senate.
3015.description: A Resolution Providing For The Permanent Rules Of The Senate.

3016.title: Establish a procedure for election contest involving State Senate District 37.
3016.description: A Resolution To Establish The Procedures To Be Followed In The Election Contest For Mississippi Senate District 37 Filed With The Secretary Of The Senate By Melanie Sojourner.

3017.title: Commend public service of Senator Steve Hale.
3017.description: A Resolution To Commend Senate Senator Steve Hale For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3018.title: Commend public service of Senator Phillip A. Gandy.
3018.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Phillip A. Gandy For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3019.title: Commend public service of Senator Kenny Wayne Jones.
3019.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Kenneth Wayne Jones For His Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3020.title: Commend public service of Senator Nancy Adams Collins.
3020.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Nancy Adams Collins For Her Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3021.title: Adopt a remedy to the election contest for Mississippi Senate District 37.
3021.description: A Resolution To Adopt A Remedy To The Election Contest For Mississippi Senate District 37 Of The Mississippi State Senate.

3022.title: Adopt Senate Rule; only Senators, Representatives, staff and public employees may be recognized to present bills in committee.
3022.description: A Resolution To Adopt Senate Rule 39a To Provide That Only Senators, Representatives, Senate Staff, Public Employees Or Private Citizens May Be Recognized To Present Or Explain Legislation To Senate Committees.

3023.title: Recognize Tupelo Christian Prep Senior Guard Claire Golding as highest-scoring women's high school basketball player in the state.
3023.description: A Resolution Recognizing Tupelo Christian Preparatory School "eagles" Senior Guard Claire Golding From Belden, Mississippi, As The Statewide Statistical Leader In Points Per Game For The 2015-2016 Season.

3024.title: Recognize 40th Anniversary and contributions of the Ralph Morgan Rodeo in Meridian, Mississippi.
3024.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Tremendous Contributions To The Sport Of Rodeo In Mississippi By Ralph Morgan On The Occasion Of The 40th Anniversary Of The Ralph Morgan Rodeo In Meridian, Mississippi.

3025.title: Commend public service of Senator Melanie Sojourner.
3025.description: A Resolution To Commend Senator Melanie Sojourner For Her Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

3026.title: Joint assembly to inaugurate Lieutenant Governor and state officials.
3026.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Provide For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature For The Inauguration Of The Lieutenant Governor And The Administration Of The Oath Of Office To Elected State Officials, And Providing For Certain Committees.

3027.title: Remember the legacy of Mississippi Civil Rights Icon Vernon Dahmer, Sr., on the 50th Anniversary of his death.
3027.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Legacy Of Mississippi Civil Rights Icon Vernon Dahmer, Sr., Of Hattiesburg, Mississippi, On The 50th Anniversary Of His Death And Declaring January 10, 2016, As "vernon Dahmer Legacy Day" In Mississippi.

3028.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and public service of former Senator Robert Monty of Greenville, Mississippi.
3028.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator Robert Anthony Monty, Formerly Of Greenville, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

3029.title: Commend MDWFP Team Wildlife for top honors in the 2015 LawFit Challenge.
3029.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Participants In The Lawfit Challenge From The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks (team Wildlife) For Taking Top Honors And Setting New Records In The 14th Annual Lawfit Challenge Held In Olive Branch, Mississippi.

3030.title: Paying tribute to Special Olympian Kyle Dutiel of Brandon, Mississippi, for winning 3 Gold Medals at World Games.
3030.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To Special Olympian Kyle Dutiel Of Brandon, Mississippi, For Winning 3 Gold Medals As An Equestrian Competitor In The Special Olympics World Games In Los Angeles, California.

3031.title: Salute Sergeant Major of the Marine Corps Ronald L. Green of Jackson.
3031.description: A Concurrent Resolution Saluting The Military Service Of Sergeant Major Of The Marine Corps Ronald L. Green Of Jackson, Mississippi.

3032.title: Salute WWII Fighter Pilot service of former Biloxi Mayor Jerry O'Keefe upon receipt of U.S. Congressional Gold Medal.
3032.description: A Concurrent Resolution Saluting The Heroic World War Ii Fighter Pilot Service Of Former Biloxi Mayor Jerry O'keefe On The Occasion Of His Receipt Of The U.s. Congressional Gold Medal.

3033.title: Recognize Senate Legislative Services Attorney William (Bubba) Neely for 2015 Carter/Hellard Award presented by SLC.
3033.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Senate Legislative Services Attorney William (bubba) Neely Upon His Receipt Of The Prestigious 2015 Carter/hellard Staff Excellence Award Presented By The Southern Legislative Conference For Distinguished And Outstanding Service To State Legislators In The South.

3034.title: Mourn the passing of Robert Sharp Forster of Oxford, Mississippi, CEO of the Mississippi Small Business Development Center.
3034.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Robert Sharp Forster Of Oxford, Mississippi, Chief Operations Officer Of The Mississippi Small Business Development Center, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature To His Family.

3035.title: Commend career and express sympathy of the Legislature on the passing of computer genius Dr. James Loton Flanagan of Greenwood.
3035.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Career Of Computer Innovator Dr. James Loton Flanagan Of Greenwood, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

3036.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and public service of former Legislator and Chancellor Talmadge Littlejohn.
3036.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator And Representative Chancellor Talmadge D. Littlejohn Of New Albany, Mississippi.

3037.title: Mourn the passing of GOP pioneer Leon C. Bramlett of Clarksdale, Mississippi.
3037.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Legacy And Mourning The Passing Of Gop Pioneer Leon C. Bramlett Of Clarksdale, Mississippi, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3038.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and public service of former Senator Alan Michael Heflin.
3038.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator Alan Michael Heflin Of Forest, Mississippi, And Express The Condolences Of The Mississippi Legislature To His Family.

3039.title: Recognize Mississippi State University Quarterback Dak Prescott as first player to win Conerly Trophy in back-to-back seasons.
3039.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Recognize Mississippi State University Quarterback Dak Prescott As The First Player In History To Win The Coveted C Spire Conerly Trophy In Back-to-back Seasons And To Commend His Stellar Football Career.

3040.title: Commend service and contributions of PEER Executive Director, Dr. Max K. Arinder.
3040.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Dr. Max K. Arinder, Former Executive Director Of The Joint Legislative Committee On Performance Evaluation And Expenditure Review (peer), And His Contributions To The Field Of Program Evaluation And Legislative Oversight.

3041.title: Commend Mississippi State University "Bulldogs" Football Team for Belk Bowl Victory.
3041.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Commend And Congratulate The Mississippi State University "bulldogs" Football Team, Coach Dan Mullen And Star Quarterback Dak Prescott For Their Successful 2015 Regular Season And Belk Bowl Victory.

3042.title: Congratulate Faith Hill for Mississippi Country Music Trail Marker in her honor.
3042.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Mississippi's Award-winning Country Music Star Faith Hill Upon The Unveiling Of The "mississippi Country Music Trail" Marker In Her Honor On December 19, 2015.

3043.title: Recognize respected Mississippi Capitol Correspondent Jack Elliott, Jr.
3043.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Thanking Longtime Mississippi Capitol Reporter And Syndicated Columnist Jack Elliott, Jr., For His Contributions To Mississippi History And To The Mississippi Legislative Process On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

3044.title: Recognize Community Builder Jack Reed, Sr., for 2015 Millsaps College Honorary Doctor of Public Service Degree.
3044.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Mississippi Community Builder Jack Reed, Sr., Of Tupelo Upon His Receipt Of The 2015 Millsaps College Honorary Doctor Of Public Service Degree.

3045.title: Commend 2015 Lewisburg High School "Lady Patriots" Volleyball Team for consecutive State Championships.
3045.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2015 Lewisburg High School "lady Patriots" Volleyball Team And Coach Allison Burchyett For Winning Consecutive Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 2 State Championships.

3046.title: Commend Lake Cormorant High School Marine JROTC Drill Team for State Championship.
3046.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Members And Instructors Of The Lake Cormorant High School Marine Corps Junior Rotc (jrotc) For Winning The Mississippi All Services Jrotc State Drill Championship At Keesler Air Force Base.

3047.title: Commend the Lewisburg High School "Marching Patriots" Band and staff for winning consecutive Class 5A State Championships.
3047.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Lewisburg High School "marching Patriots" Band And Director Kim Hallmark For Winning Consecutive Class 5a State Marching Band Championships.

3048.title: Commend Bill Holmes' legacy as longtime Executive Director of Mississippi Coast Coliseum Commission.
3048.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Commend The Career And Legacy Of Public Service Of William F. "bill" Holmes, And Congratulating Him Upon The Special Occasion Of His Retirement As Longtime Executive Director Of The Mississippi Coast Coliseum Commission.

3049.title: Commend the Hernando High School "Marching Tigers" Band and staff for winning consecutive Class 6A State Championships.
3049.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Hernando High School "marching Tigers" Band And Director Len Killough For Winning Consecutive Class 6a State Marching Band Championships.

3050.title: Recognize positive influence of Alcorn State University "Braves" Head Football Coach Jay Hopson and commend 2015 SWAC Championship.
3050.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Positive Influence Of Alcorn State University Head Football Coach Jay Hopson And Congratulating The "braves" For Their 2015 Southwestern Athletic Conference (swac) Football Championship.

3051.title: Mourn the loss of Legendary Alcorn State University Trailblazer Basketball Coach Davey Whitney.
3051.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Legendary Alcorn State University Trailblazer Basketball Coach Davey Whitney And Extending The Condolences Of The Legislature To His Surviving Family.

3052.title: Mourn the passing of Mississippi Blues-Gospel-Soul Artist Otis Clay of Bolivar County, Mississippi.
3052.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Mississippi Blues-gospel-soul Artist Otis Clay Of Bolivar County, Mississippi, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature To His Bereaved Family.

3053.title: Congratulate Erin Morgan as Mississippi's 2015 Miss Hospitality.
3053.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Erin Morgan Of Laurel, Mississippi, Upon Being Crowned Mississippi's 2015 Miss Hospitality.

3054.title: Congratulate "National American Miss Mississippi Junior Teen" Alanis Takira Johnson of Madison, Mississippi.
3054.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Alanis Takira Johnson Of Germantown High School In Madison, Mississippi, As "national American Miss Mississippi Junior Teen."

3055.title: Recognize Jackson Prep "Patriots" Football Team and Coach Ricky Black for "4-Peat" State Championship.
3055.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Recognize And Salute The Jackson Preparatory School "patriots" Football Team And Head Coach Ricky Black For Their 4th Consecutive State Title Which Is Their 22nd Mais Class Aaa Title.

3056.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life of former Senator, Representative, and Attorney William Sidney Guy, Jr.
3056.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator And Mississippi Representative And Respected Attorney William Sidney Guy, Jr, Originally Of Mccomb, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

3057.title: Recognize four decades of public service by former Circuit Court Judge Joe Pigott of McComb and expressing sympathy on his passing.
3057.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Four Decades Of Public Service By Former Circuit Court Judge Joe Ned Pigott Of Mccomb, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

3058.title: Congratulate the Ole Miss "Rebels" Football Team and Head Coach Hugh Freeze for victory in 2016 Sugar Bowl.
3058.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The University Of Mississippi Ole Miss "rebels" Football Team And Head Coach Hugh Freeze For Their Victory In The 2016 Allstate Sugar Bowl.

3059.title: Welcome North Mississippi Allstars Band as Music Ambassadors for the State of Mississippi.
3059.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The North Mississippi Allstars Band As Unofficial Musical Ambassadors For The State Of Mississippi And Welcoming Them On The Occasion Of The Mississippi Tourism Association Legislative Reception On January 27, 2016.

3060.title: Congratulate MS Supreme Court Justice and former Representative Randy Pierce on new position as Director of MS Judicial College.
3060.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating Mississippi Supreme Court Justice And Former Mississippi Representative Randy (bubba) Pierce On The Occasion Of His Retirement From The Bench And Transition As Director Of The Mississippi Judicial College.

3061.title: Recognize Dr. Olen Wayne Gann for his educational legacy as his term as Chairman of the State Board of Education expires.
3061.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Recognition Of The Mississippi Legislature For The Educational Legacy Of State Board Of Education Chairman Dr. Olen Wayne Gann.

3062.title: Recognize Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal Editor Lloyd Gray as new Executive Director of The Phil Hardin Foundation.
3062.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Executive Editor Of The Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal Lloyd Gray For His Appointment As The New Executive Director Of The Phil Hardin Foundation.

3063.title: Congratulate Scott Barretta for 2016 Governor's Arts Award in Mississippi heritage.
3063.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Renowned Blues Scholar And Journalist Scott Barretta Upon His Receipt Of The 2016 Governor's Arts Award In Mississippi Heritage.

3064.title: Congratulate Tom "Bones" Malone for 2016 Governor's Arts Award for Lifetime Achievement.
3064.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Renowned Musician Tom "bones" Malone Upon His Receipt Of The 2016 Governor's Arts Award For Lifetime Achievement.

3065.title: Congratulate Claudia Cartee for 2016 Governor's Arts Award for Excellence in Visual Arts.
3065.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Renowned Clay Craftsman Claudia Cartee Upon Her Receipt Of The 2016 Governor's Arts Award For Excellence In Visual Arts.

3066.title: Congratulate Tig Notaro for 2016 Governor's Arts Award for Artist Achievement.
3066.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Renowned Comedian Tig Notaro Upon Her Receipt Of The 2016 Governor's Arts Award For Artist Achievement.

3067.title: Congratulate Dr. Tommie "Tonea" Stewart for 2016 Governors Arts Award for Excellence in Acting.
3067.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Renown Actress Dr. Tommie "tonea" Stewart Of Greenwood, Mississippi, Upon Her Receipt Of The 2016 Governors Arts Award For Excellence In Acting.

3068.title: Commend Robert R. Latham, Jr., for his service as Executive Director of MEMA.
3068.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Selfless Service And Dedicated Career Of Robert R. Latham, Jr., Upon His Retirement As The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency.

3069.title: Congratulate People of Taiwan for successful conclusion of Presidential elections and reaffirming Mississippi's policy.
3069.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating The People Of Taiwan For The Successful Conclusion Of Presidential Elections On Saturday, January 16, 2016, And Reaffirming The State Of Mississippi's Free Market Policy Toward Taiwan And The Republic Of China.

3070.title: Recognize the exemplary ministerial career and civic leadership of Pastor Sonny Adkins of Mendenhall, Mississippi.
3070.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Exemplary Ministerial Career And Civic Leadership Of Pastor Sonny Adkins Of Mendenhall, Mississippi, And Extending The Best Wishes Of The Legislature.

3071.title: Recognize dedicated public service of DHS Executive Director Rickey Berry on occasion of his retirement.
3071.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Dedicated Public Service Of Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Human Services Richard (rickey) A. Berry On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

3072.title: Recognize New Stage Theatre on its 50th Anniversary Celebration.
3072.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing New Stage Theatre, Mississippi's Only Resident Professional Theatre, On The Occasion Of Its 50th Anniversary Celebration.

3073.title: Mourn the loss of longtime State Representative Esther Harrison.
3073.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Condolences Of The Mississippi Legislature To The Surviving Family Of Longtime State Representative Esther Harrison.

3074.title: Urge Congress to call constitutional convention to limit campaign spending.
3074.description: A Concurrent Resolution Petitioning The United States Congress To Convene A Limited Convention For The Exclusive Purpose Of Proposing A Free And Fair Elections Amendment To The United States Constitution.

3075.title: Recognize MHP Director Colonel Donnell Berry on occasion of his retirement.
3075.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Professional Law Enforcement Service Of Mississippi Highway Patrol Director Colonel Donnell Berry On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

3076.title: Mourn the loss of fallen Hattiesburg Police Patrolman Benjamin J. Deen.
3076.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Condolences Of The Legislature To The Surviving Family And Pay Tribute To The Memory Of Hattiesburg Police Patrolman Benjamin J. Deen.

3077.title: Commend Northwest Mississippi Community College "Rangers" Football Team for 2015 NJCAA National Championship.
3077.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Northwest Mississippi Community College "rangers" Football Team And Head Coach Jack Wright For Winning Its First National Junior College Athletic Association (njcaa) National Championship Since 1992.

3078.title: Recognize 2016 American Red Cross Humanitarian Award Recipient Ted Moll of Tupelo, Mississippi.
3078.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Paying Tribute To The Civic Leadership Of Ted Moll Of Tupelo, Mississippi, As The Recipient Of The 2016 American Red Cross Humanitarian Award And Extending The Best Wishes Of The Legislature.

3079.title: Recognize 50th Anniversary Celebration of North Mississippi Rural Legal Services (NMRLS) and commend mission.
3079.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The 50th Anniversary Celebration Of North Mississippi Rural Legal Services (nmrls) And Commending Their Mission Of Advocacy.

3080.title: Mourn the passing of education champion and community builder Jack R. Reed, Sr., of Tupelo.
3080.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Mississippi Education Champion And Community Builder Jack Raymond Reed, Sr., Of Tupelo And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature To His Family.

3081.title: Commend Hannah Roberts for being named the First Runner-Up in the Miss America Pageant.
3081.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Congratulations Of The Mississippi Legislature To 2015 Miss Mississippi Hannah Roberts Of Sumrall, Mississippi, Who Was Named First Runner-up In The Miss America Pageant.

3082.title: Constitution of 1890; amend Section 17A to permanently prohibit certain transfers of land acquired through eminent domain.
3082.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 17a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Make Perpetual The Restriction On Sale Or Transfer Of Property Acquired Through Eminent Domain; And For Related Purposes.

3083.title: Mourn the loss of former 6th District Chancellor Edward Prisock of Louisville, Mississippi.
3083.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss Of Former 6th District Chancellor Edward C. (ed) Prisock Of Louisville, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3084.title: Mourn the passing of Dr. Arthur Bennett Peyton, Sr., respected Greenville educator and civic leader.
3084.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Deepest Sympathy Of The Mississippi Legislature To The Bereaved Family Of Respected Greenville Educator And Civic Leader Dr. Arthur Bennett Peyton, Sr.

3085.title: Commend DeSoto Central "Lady Jags" for winning State Volleyball Championship.
3085.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2015 Desoto Central High School "lady Jags" Volleyball Team And Coach Margaret Falatko For Winning Three Consecutive Mississippi High School Activities Association State Championships.

3086.title: Urge the U.S. Dept. of the Treasury to place a woman's face on our paper currency in honor of 100th Anniversary of Women's Suffrage.
3086.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The United States Department Of The Treasury To Place A Woman's Face On Our Paper Currency In Honor Of The 100th Anniversary Of The Women's Suffrage Constitutional Amendment In 2020.

3087.title: Public universities; amend Const. to provide for a State University System and local Boards of Trustees.
3087.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Clarify That The Legislature Shall Make Adequate Provision By Law For The Establishment, Maintenance And Operation Of The 8 Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi, To Provide For A State University System Comprised Of The 8 Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi, To Establish A System Of Governance For The State University System Of Mississippi, To Provide For A Board Of Governors For The Management Of The State University System Comprised Of The Membership Of The Present Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Board Of Governors Of The State University System, To Provide For Local Boards Of Trustees For The Administration Of Each University In The State University System And To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Local Boards Of Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

3088.title: Commend Delta Sigma Theta on Delta Day at the Capitol.
3088.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Madison County, Jackson And Clinton Chapters Of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc., Along With Jackson Alumnae Delta Enterprise, Inc., (jade), On The Occasion Of Mississippi Delta Day At The Capitol In 2016.

3089.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and public service of former Senator "Son" Rhodes of Vancleave.
3089.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator William C. "son" Rhodes Of Vancleave, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

3090.title: Designating first week in February 2016 as "Enrolled Agent Week in Mississippi."
3090.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The First Week In February 2016 As "enrolled Agent Week In Mississippi" To Recognize The Role Of Enrolled Agents In The Tax Industry In Our State.

3091.title: United States Constitution; urge Congress to propose amendment to restrict federal/regulatory authority.
3091.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging Congress To Propose The "regulation Freedom Amendment" To The U.s. Constitution.

3092.title: Joint Rules of Mississippi Legislature; amend to provide that Legislature shall not convene on Easter Sunday.
3092.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Joint Rule No. 40 To Provide That The Legislature Shall Not Convene On Easter Sunday.

3093.title: Congratulate 2016 AKA Sorority on Policy Impact Day at the Capitol.
3093.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated, On The Occasion Of Its Policy Impact "2016 Aka Day At The Mississippi State Capitol" To Promote Advocacy And Take Action For Civil Rights, Social Justice And Health Promotion Initiatives.

3094.title: Mourn the passing of Mississippi Civil Rights icon Winifred A. Green of Jackson, Mississippi.
3094.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Mississippi Civil Rights Icon Winifred A. Green Of Jackson, Mississippi.

3095.title: Constitution; prohibit pardon of certain violent crimes and revise notice requirements for other crimes.
3095.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Governor Cannot Grant Pardons For Certain Violent Crimes And To Require Publication Of Notice Before The Governor Pardons Certain Other Felony Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

3096.title: Constitution; change terms of office of members of State Board of Education from nine to four years.
3096.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 203 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Change The Terms Of Office Of The Members Of The State Board Of Education From 9 To 4 Years; And For Related Purposes.

3097.title: Mourn the passing of NFL and JSU football legend and former DFA Administrator Willie Richardson.
3097.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Nfl And Jackson State University Football Legend And Former Department Of Finance And Administration Capitol Facilities Director Willie Richardson And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3098.title: Mourn the passing of legendary Mississippi Delta Political Leader Dr. Juniper Yates "J.Y" Trice.
3098.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature To The Bereaved Family Of Rosedale Mayor, Pastor, Social Activist And Legendary Mississippi Delta Political Leader Dr. Juniper Yates "j.y." Trice.

3099.title: Recognize Sesquicentennial (150th) Celebration of establishment of historic Rust College in Holly Springs, Mississippi.
3099.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Sesquicentennial (150th) Celebration Of The Establishment Of Historic Rust College In Holly Springs, Mississippi.

3100.title: PERS; request a study on SLRP to determine the feasibility of closing or allowing members to opt out.
3100.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Request The Public Employees' Retirement System To Conduct A Study Of The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan (slrp) To Determine The Feasibility And Cost Of Closing Slrp To New Members And/or Offering Members The Ability To Opt Out Of Slrp; To Require Pers To File A Report With The Legislature By Not Later Than December 1, 2016; And For Related Purposes.

3101.title: Department of Revenue; requested to conduct a feasibility regarding the elimination of ad valorem taxation.
3101.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Request The Department Of Revenue To Study The Feasibility Of Phasing Out And Eliminating The Imposition Of Ad Valorem Taxes On All Property In This State; And For Related Purposes.

3102.title: Recognize effective public service of Eddie Dixon as President of the Mississippi Association of Supervisors.
3102.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Legacy Of Effective Public Service Of Longtime Marshall County Supervisor Eddie Dixon As President Of The Mississippi Association Of Supervisors.

3103.title: Recognize Legislative members of Kappa Alpha Psi and designate February 16, 2016, as "Kappa Day at the State Capitol."

3206.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Saltillo "tigers" Boys' Cross-country Team And Coach Charles Covington For Winning The 2015 Mhsaa 5a State Championship, Their Fifth State Championship.

3207.title: Congratulate La'Porsha Renae Jennings for outstanding performance on "American Idol" television production.
3207.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Powerful Musical Talent Of Mccomb, Mississippi's La'porsha Renae Jennings And Congratulating Her For Her Outstanding Performance On The "american Idol" Television Production.

3208.title: Congratulate Gautier High School Teacher Jodi McKenzie upon her selection as "2016 Mississippi Teacher of the Year."
3208.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Gautier High School Teacher Jodi Mckenzie Upon Her Selection As "2016 Mississippi Teacher Of The Year."

3209.title: Suspend rules for drafting, etc.; repeal HB 1523, which is the "Protecting Freedom of Conscience from Government Discrimination Act."
3209.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Repeal House Bill No. 1523 (2016 Regular Session), Which Is The 'protecting Freedom Of Conscience From Government Discrimination Act.'"

3210.title: Urge medical community to raise awareness about the risks of atrial fibrillation and stroke and availability of treatment.
3210.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The State Department Of Health And The Medical Community To Raise Awareness About The Risks Posed By Atrial Fibrillation And Stroke And The Availability Of Treatment Options.

3211.title: Congratulate Dr. W. Mark Donald as 52nd President of the Academy of General Dentistry.
3211.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating W. Mark Donald, Dmd, Magd On Becoming The 52nd President Of The Academy Of General Dentistry 2015-2016.

3212.title: Celebrate the 200th Anniversary of Natchez Children's Services.
3212.description: A Concurrent Resolution Joining The City Of Natchez In Celebrating The 200th Anniversary Of Natchez Children's Services.

3213.title: Recognize the 50th Anniversary of the "March Against Fear" led by James Meredith and dedication of the Capitol Marker.
3213.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Dedication Of The Mississippi Freedom Trail "capitol Rally" Marker On The North Side Of The State Capitol Which Commemorates The 50th Anniversary Of The "march Against Fear" Led By James Meredith And Other Civil Rights Pioneers Which Is The Largest Such Demonstration In Mississippi's History.

3214.title: Commend Moss Point High School "Tigers" Girls Powerlifting Team for winning Class II State Championship.
3214.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Moss Point High School "tigers" Girls Powerlifting Team And Coach Kyle Mickelson For Winning The Mhsaa Class Ii State Championship In Only Their Second Year.

3215.title: Joint Rules of the Senate and the House; repeal.
3215.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Repeal The Joint Rules Of The Senate And The House.
